The fish was packed with flavor and the texture was like butter.  Portions were small on this entree but the quality was amazing.  The bread they served with the meal was light as air.

The sandwiches on the menu are under $10 and have pretty big portions.  The crawpuppies were also very tasty.  I cannot wait to go back!

Lola's is in a great spot near the outlet mall off Charleston and the i15 freeway.  Been here for lunch several times and the food has always been excellent.  So far, I have had the Lola's Crab Cakes, Jambalaya with Chicken and Sausage, and the Blackened Catfish with Grits (my favorite).  There are many other items on the menu that look amazing, just haven't had the opportunity to try them all.  This is by far the best Cajun spot in town.

Love this spot, living downtown I'm here at least once a week to eat. Can't go wrong with the red beans and rice, or the Gouda grits. Service is always great and the gm is great! I've never left not satisfied!

I always give all the stars.  This one is not going to happen.  I'm not a critic, I'm just a hungry lady.  This place is an abortion of Cajun Cuisine.

My guy & I stopped in after antiquing nearby.  We were ravenous & we adore Cajun food.  I was so excited to have a place in town to get nourished with my favorites.

We were seated & served some drinks after a spell.  There was only one poor waitress from AK there & she had 5 tables.  She came to take our order..........then we waited.......turned another decade older, then our food came.
I'm from Tenn & have lived in LA.  This chow wasn't fit for a POW.  My gumbo had formed a hard shell on the top.  So I asked the waitress if it comes from the oven.  She explained that it came from a pot.... (no kidding)  So my inner "Colombo" deduces that it sat under a heat lamp.  If you buy the gumbo & select shrimp, you get 3 of them.   Oh Boy, for $11-$12.99 you can get 3 shrimp on top of a heat lamp-ed dish of gumbo, Id rather stay home & eat zatarains.

Plus I found a nice big piece of bacon in my gumbo.  Now if they use that to make a roux, that's forgivable, but even then its to be crumbled.

Worst restaurant in Vegas.

The crab cakes and the shrimp and grits are sinfully good. It's busy, but not cramped. Thier chicory coffee is Cafe du Monde, my favorite New Orleans style coffee brand, and they give you a whole pot! I'm too full for dessert, but I will definitely come back next time I'm in Downtown LV!

This place was recommended to me by a client. She made the Gouda Grits sound so good I had to check it out. This place is everything everyone says it is. Great food and service. It's very intimate, so reservations are a must.

We started with Abita Strawberry Beer on tap... Crisp and refreshing!  Hot Crap and Artichoke Dip with the toasted bread then delicious Shrimp platter half fried half blacken with Sweet Potato fries and red beans and rice amazing!  Server Bethany was a sweet and courteous!  Made girls night out one to remember!

I don't write reviews on this but I felt it necessary to write one for Lola's. Now let me start with the positives its right down the street from my office so its convenient, and that's about it. I ordered a crab cake for an appetizer which was mediocre to somewhat good at best and it was $7.00 for one! Then for lunch I ordered the shrimp creole which was absolutely nothing special although the shrimp were cooked absolutely perfectly.  The shrimp creole was $16.99 and only came with 5 shrimp!!! Seriously I'm only getting 5 shrimp for 17 dollars you have got to be kidding me! I wouldn't have minded if the dish was mind blowing or if it was something that I had absolutely zero chance of replicating at home but that just simply isn't true. I could make this dish at home with ease! So if I were you I would find another creole place for much better value. I'm still confused how this is the best in Las Vegas
The crawpuppies are only 4 small pieces per order and it is $5.99!  They don't taste good either.  Be more generous Lola's!

Red beans and rice excellent.  Oysters are decent.  The meat po bo not that good. Great la beat. Cole slaw and toast excellent.  Service was a little lacking.  Prices are ok but would expect service to be better for the price.  I'd go again, see if the improve wait-staff training.

Great food
Quaint little place
Would recommend for lunch or dinner
Smaller dining area
Excellent staff

My husband and I went to Lola's on Saturday night. He was born and raised in Shreveport, LA so he knows southern cooking. He ordered the Shrimp and Grits and was in heaven. He said this dish was as good as Brennen's in the French Quarter. I ordered the Chicken and Sausage Jambalaya and it was the best I have ever had. To end a spectacular meal, my husband ordered Mamma Deaux's Banana Pudding. He was immediately transported back to his childhood - Nill Wafers and all. At the end of our meal, Lola sat down and chatted with us and a local couple. She is as warm and welcoming as her restaurant and her down home comfort food. We will be returning every time we come to Vegas. I recommend you go early as the restaurant is small and very busy.

Lola's is an average Cajun restaurant located Downtown. I used to think it was a great Cajun restaurant, but after trying some other Cajun spots around town, I've had to temper my enthusiasm a bit.

My usual Cajun order is jambalaya, which is decent here. The portion size is a bit small for the price, but not exorbitant. The last time I had the jambalaya it was a bit bland and didn't have any kick. It wasn't bad, but I was a bit disappointed.

Had the orange salad with blackened salmon and was floored at how good it was! It had the perfect accompaniments, spot on dressing! Also had a crab cake the start, which was moist, tender and very tasty! Love this place!

A sad little restaurant. The red beans and rice tasted like like it was old. The blackened catfish  looked like it was beat up and it tasted like it too. The food was just bad. Service is pretty terrible too. This restaurant is not a serious place.

Lola's has pretty much become a staple of every one of our Las Vegas trips. Hell it may be the meal we look forward to the most. It's one of the best DDD features we've been to so far. 

Every single dish here just feels so authentic and flavorful. From the catfish and the jambalaya to the gouda grits and the grilled shrimp, each item is memorably different from the rest of the food around and other Cajun restaurants to which we've been. It doesn't feel like the flavors are from a seasoning thrown at the end (the way places call French fries with some old bay seasoning on top Cajun fries). Instead, each dish is naturally and purposefully infused with different notes of heat and spice.

For me, the joy of this restaurant comes in the form of the shrimp Charlotte. I've never had a pasta like it, where the flavor and pasta are one in the same and no sauce at all is needed. And the shrimp are grilled perfectly. It's a dish that is intriguing all the way through and with each bite, you wonder how they accomplish so much with just angel hair pasta and if you could somehow figure it out and make something just half as good  because that would be a success. 

When you visit Vegas, go visit Lola's. And save room for dessert. I never have (can't help myself) but they rave about their bread pudding, and their descriptions only make them harder to turn down.

We have previously dined at both this, the original, location and its newer  restaurant in Summerlin so we barely looked at the menu before ordering bronzed catfish and Gouda grits entrees along with a side of rainbow coleslaw.   There may not have been as much catfish as in the past, but the generous portion of Gouda grits more than compensated.  The fish itself was perfectly prepared and delicious.  One cautionary note:  this is not the best choice for an intimate meal as it is small, crowded and loud.

This is one of those places that I've had on my list for a while, but just never made it here and I regret not coming earlier! We dined here with a large group of friends a couple months ago and had a lovely time. 

I made reservations over the phone and they were very accommodating, which says a lot since it's such a small space. On that note, I highly recommend reservations for your group!

Crawpuppies ($5.29): Minced crawfish blended with spices and fried; served with housemade cajun aioli. YUM! Nothing to hate about these little puppies.

House Cut French Fries ($2.99): It's no secret that I love fries and these are AMAZING. The perfect mix of crunch and a soft interior with great flavor.

Bronzed Shrimp & Grits ($16.99): Gulf shrimp served over Gouda grits with an andouille sausage and mushroom ragout. SO. GOOD. The shrimp were cooked perfectly. The grits are DELICIOUS and that ragout really pushed the dish over the edge. 

Jambalaya-Chicken & Sausage; ADD Shrimp ($14.99): Ruben and I LOVE jambalaya and this one was no exception. Great flavors!!

The food was fantastic and so far, it's the best place I've been to in town serving up Cajun/Creole food! I'm definitely looking forward to my next visit.

Small restaurant and I'd rather sit outside unless its too hot. The shrimp and grits are always good. Ive not had a dish I wouldnt order again. Service is usually spotty. But I'd go again at a minutes notice.

Quick service, great description of all entrees. Meals came out quick, flavor was so multi dimensional( had the golden shrimp and grits) left my plate clean. Great size portions. This is a place I will definitely come back to when I come back to Vegas. Better than anything I have had on the strip for the price.

We wanted to like this place when we got there since I know the sister of the owner
We had terrible service from a girl named Katrina. 

Hank the manager was there, nice guy, but because of the disregard and rudeness my family never returned

First impressions are everything. 

I ordered the red beans and rice. 

Because of the poor service we received, I left the minimum tip, and in front of this server, I purposely whipped out a stack of $100 bills, looking for some 20's. 

Without that particular server I'd have visited more often at this location
Instead I heard there was a second
I never went, too far across town. 

Didn't care for the vibe from the waitress. You are there to SERVE ME and represent the face of a business, not to come into work with a chip on your shoulder. 
We said nothing to her, weren't rude. 
Paid the bill never to return
Sad cause I'm a Saints fan and I love New Orleans and thier inspired menu

Love this place. Great cajun food with above average service. Their po boys are great and I always enjoy the étouffée plus the crappies. They have the whole range of Arbita beer plus a few on tap now. Only thing bad about this place is it is a bit small so the tables are right on top of each other plus a bit noisy.
The gumbo is the best. Also the grits. Definitely have dessert at the the end, the bread pudding is bomb.

Fan-freakin-tastic!!!! Awesome atmosphere, great wait staff and above all AWESOME food!! Must get the crawpuppies, shrimp  with Gouda grits is rock your world amazing and the banana pudding is the perfect treat to top off an amazing meal!! Hidden Gem!!!

High expectation, a bit disappointing! Their idea of Cajun food and spices it seemed was just tons of pepper in every dish so your mouth would burn but not happily. Dishes were very mediocre, mmmmmm!!

Red beans and rice awesome. Guoda grits good taste but thick when it cooled it became too thick. Crawfish hush puppies strong lemon and spice not pleasant. Catfish po boy great catfish flavor just 1 piece way too much bread. Free parking in a funky little lot on an odd corner. Super small place go early or wait. Filled up fast. After reading all reviews and being on DDD we expected more.

This was our first visit to Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen. It is located in a weird, obscure place and is very small.  Parking is located a little further away from the restaurant in a parking lot. 
We ordered a basket of fried okra for an appetizer. It was delivered hot and fresh. 
Our waiter was courteous and delivered the food promptly. 
We had the shrimp and grits, as well as the shrimp creole. 
The shrimp & grits were very flavorful and I recommend them; however, be informed, you only receive five shrimp (tail on) on each of these dishes.  For the $18.00 charge per plate, surely, patrons should receive a few more shrimp and a larger portion. 
Overall, the portions are quite small. 
The shrimp creole lacked a lot of flavor and was pretty disappointing. 
With so many great choices in LV, I don't know if I'll return to this restaurant.
Such a fun atmosphere! The food was really grea and the decor was straight out of Louisiana. I have only been here once but it was an unforgetable experiance and I plan on coming back for more!

Have any of you been put on the spot to find a good place to eat, that suits everybody's wants? Ha silly question. Well that's what was asked of me bu some of my parents friends visiting. I got to my trusty Yelp app, read reviews from trusty Yelpers and came across this place. Now, it can't be just any ol soul food, but I told them it had really good reviews. In the car we go and head there. Woops, it's so quick off the freeway we missed it! Take the streets and try again, a little slower this time and we found it. 

This place is literally a hole in the wall-so small. But those are usually the best ones. We were seated, read over the menu with Michael Jackson playing in the background, so singing and reading. They have a good variety on their menu, greens, potato salad, coleslaw, etc.  However, I did not see mac and cheese. I was a little bummed, but knew I would find something else. I ordered the catfish with a side of greens and sweet potato fries. Some others got the same, and 2 ordered the catfish Po-boy. Now I wait for the food to arrive, and hope it's to their liking. Reputation is on the line. Food comes out and set on the table. I take a bite of mine, delicious. I can't have catfish without dousing it in hot sauce, but it was good. The greens and sweet potato fries were done just right. I love a crispy sweet potato fry. 

Now, 1 of the 2 was picky about her soul food and when she took a bite, I just looked at her, hoping good news was to follow. She took another bite and said, "Ok this is pretty good. I like the way they fry their catfish." Wahoo!  Do a little dance. I was happy she enjoyed her food, and that I could enjoy mine too, cause it was delicious. 

Would I come back? Yes, the people in there were really nice and the food was really tasty, with good music to go with it. What more could you ask for?

lolas was just ok...luckily I have a two-try rule.  
It was my first time at this establishment.  and overall it was just OK.  I decided to treat my mom to lunch and when we walked in it was about 85 degrees in the dining room. Why you ask, the front door was perched open.  Why you ask, i have no idea...we are in the desert the last time i checked. Anywho, i ordered gumbo & a catfish poboy. Both were delish. My mom ordered the red beans & rice...she enjoyed her choice. For me a good dining experience usually means good food & good service. the food was good the service was just ok. no smiling faces when seated, no smiling face from our waiter.  Actually the only time the waiter smiled was when he asked to clear the table and I said yes. I am eager to give Lola's one more try! Next time i will bring a fan.

FOODIEDIVA.com

Although the owners are from Louisianna, I was disappointed as my expectations were extremely high.  The shrimp with remoulade was bland.  Something was definitely missing in the ingredients.  My main course of crawfish etoufee was just as disappointing and bland and didn't look good. Sorry but this is another Diners, Drive Ins and Dive disappointment in my opinion. This is a delayed review from April 2014, I've had health issues.

We found this place after Mundo closed down and we event disappointed.  The service is fast and friendly and the food is authentic NOLA. From the gumbo to the char broiled oysters you will not be disappointed.  The only thing they were lacking was a kids menu.  The place is no where near fine dining, so why not offers a kids portion of fried shrimp and fries?
this place was awesome so much variety in cajun food and the desserts were amazing. simply one of the greatest little restaurants in vegas

Definitely get the crawfish!! I love how they make it here. Move over boiling crab and hot n juicy! Only thing is, they only serve crawfish on weekends but you can always expect them to be fresh. Shrimp and grits! Doooo it. Ive never had grits before so I didn't know what to expect but it reminded me of polenta so I liked it. And the sauce went with the grilled shrimp. I couldn't choose between their desserts but the chocolate cake and bananas foster bread pudding is delicious!! It's to die for. Get them a la mode! You won't regret it. I couldn't choose so I got both and finished it alllll. Servers are extremely friendly and attentive. They have outdoor and bar seating as well. Casual place to grab dinner and drinks. I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves seafood, especially New Orleans style kind of food.
Some of the most authentic creole food I've had since visiting family in Louisiana!  We will be returning often for more of this deliciousness.
A taste of New Orleans indeed... Missing the food on NOLA and went had my chargrilled oysters and catfish and grits,   It's Delish

The food was great. The only complaint I have is I ordered the Gumbo it wasn't until I got to the last few bites I can taste that it was scorched or the rice was burnt. I went on 7/6/16. I was personally having a bad day and The waitress honestly made my experience worrh it she was attentive other than the bunrt taste at the end everything else we order was great. No I didn't complain about the gumbo I do plan on going back for the desserts. The reviews of the bread pudding alone is worth me going before I leave LV. Hope everyone gives this place a try.

Funniest comment I heard from my coworkers after we ate at Lola "for the quality of food they served and for the price they charged, they should have thrown in a lap dance for free."

The comment above basically summarized our first and last experience at Lola's. We work near downtown and usually venture out to eat for lunch, especially when new place popped up. 

First the service, the waiter was unfriendly and only showed up to take order and bring our food (an hour later). Beside that, he didn't even care to check on us at all. I give service a "D"

As many of you have commented on here, make sure you eat before you come to Lola because by the time your food arrives, you would have fainted from hunger already. It shouldn't take like a whole freaking hour just to bring us fried catfish po boy, especially when the food portion is small and has no seasoning at all. I give food quality a "D"

This place is pricey but the portion is extremely small. $13 for a small catfish po boy with barely any fish in it. Crawpuppies were extremely tiny and salty. I'm the type of person would pay good money for good food, but I will not pay outraging price for crappy food. I give food value a "D-"

Overall, this place failed badly and I'm surprised of the 4 stars review for this place.

Love it!!! Thank you to my friend for telling me to look up Diners, Drive-In's and Dives. I was in the mood for spicy so my family and I made the short drive from our hotel to here. The GPS took me a block or two away to a very ghetto area. Thank god it wasn't there. Lol. We went at 7:45 on a weekday and were out by 8:30. Good service, fairly quick arrival of food.

My son got the chicken strip & fries. He said the chicken didn't have taste but didn't like the ranch sauce. He ended up loving it though, wanting more. It was light and crispy.

I got the hot wings extra spicy and boy they do not mess around!!!! It opened up all my pores on my face and scalp. It was heaven!! The jambalaya with extra sausage was delicious too! My mouth was still on fire so I don't know if it was spicy or not, but it was tasty!

Hubby got the gumbo and that was so good too! I love okra so it was great. I also liked his beer but I forgot what it was. Turbo Dog or something...

I was full but couldn't resist dessert and got the bread pudding. Other than the raisins (I don't like raisins) it was delicious!

I will definitely come back here when I am in Vegas again!!

Ok...for you true Cajuns this is the only place outside of the south where you will find a REAL shrimp poboy. Fresh shrimp; crunchy on the outside, fresh on the inside. REAL New Orleans French bread; crispy and soft. Party in my mouth!! The waitress even knew what I meant when I ordered it "sloppy".  A must for all you southerners who miss the real thing

Best Cajun food west of Louisiana!!!!!!  And they serve Abita beer.  Portions and service were great.   You definitely have to try the crab and artichoke dip.  Way more crab than I would have ever expected.
I am never disappointed in Lola's. I am so in love with this place :) The Banana's Foster is to die for!

I wanted to like this place so bad given the fact my boyfriend was ranting and raving about it.

Though I enjoyed the grilled bread, the po boy and red beans and rice (or maybe because I was extremely hungry) I could not say it was anything remotely close to the authenticity to the great flavors of NOLA food. 

The gumbo was horrid! It was a disgrace to even title it as such! My boyfriend who has been going there for years even said it didn't taste how it use to. The issue began when we told the server that we didn't like the taste and would like it to be sent back and taken off of our tab. They refused and stated it was against policy. Our server sent over a wannabe manager to repeat the same thing. She stated that if I were to say gumbo were too spicy then she would be able to take it off of the bill. I'm thinking to myself "what difference does that make??!" After my boyfriend and her went back a forth for awhile, she then admitted that the gumbo had been changed a couple of weeks ago. Which should had been a green light the gumbo to be refunded. Still no budging! So I interjected and suggested that we replace our gumbo for something else. In which they did with no problem. We ate, tipped, and left!

Would I return here again? Nope. I don't see it happening!

We usually eat here at least 2-3 times each trip, The bronzed shrimp and grits and bronzed catfish and grits are a 10 out of 10. Amazingly good. Tried the charbroiled oysters but they were overcooked and stuck to the shell. the chicken wings were very average. The Bbq shrimp was good, and the sauce they are in is outstanding, Make sure to get extra bread to sop it up with. They also sell t-shirts which are cute.

We went on a quiet weekday for an early dinner. Menu is mostly seafood. We each got a po'boy sandwich. They were okay, but not for the price. The sandwich was heavy on the bread and light on the fillings. Fries and coleslaw were good. 

Our waitress was nice and attentive, but the curtain to the kitchen was open while we dined, and we were treated to competing radios. The dining room had some nice easy-going music that matched the theme, but the young kitchen staff was blasting some heavy metal and goofing around loudly. I wouldn't mind if I paid ten bucks for my meal at a food court, but when you're charged $15 for a small sandwich, you don't want to feel like you're intruding on a staff party. 

I doubt I would return.

We were able to make same day reservations. The food was amazing! I ordered the catfish and grits, the fish was deliciously seasoned and the grits were smooth. My friends and I had a great time with good food. I totally recommend this place and will go back again. :)

A great authentic American Cuisine.  I have to say , I am not a huge purveyor of Southern cooking, however, after reading yelper Michelle W review of the place, figured we had to give it a shot.  Had clients in town from Italy and France and one of my colleagues wanted to try Rhythm Kitchen and so I suggested Lola's.

1.  Quaint - When you are traipsing around the Charleston area, me thinks the last thing you are going to think about is quaint, cute, cool.  This place is all that and has character. Small, few tables, small bar, and it has just enough of whatever it is to make it just right.

2.  Service - Dominic was there when we entered waiting for our guests. Very nice, knowledgeable, gave us the scoop on the wine he preferred and also on the food.  They set up our table nicely and when we had to add one more, they were very accommodating. We had a party of 9 in here and they took care of us.  I think the place serves 20-25 total?

3.  Food - I was looking to give our out of towners a unique experience to try something uniquely American.  So this is the place we chose.  

Crab Cakes and Craw Puppies - The crab cakes were very substantial, flaky, moist and tender. I enjoyed it.  It was one per order, however, as they are decent size, we asked for each to be cut in two pieces and we ordered enough to share. Ordered craw puppies for the table, never having this before.  Deep fried seafood is the best I can describe this.  Not greasy and bite size tasty bits of seafood. Nice.  Each is the size of a small meatball, 5 per order, so we split two orders.  

Jambalaya - to me, the right blend of spice, rice, seafood. I also ordered the shrimp as an addition and it was just right. Juicy and hits the spot.

Salmon and Sweet potato fries - I think this was the only let down.  The fries had such great flavor yet the salmon was very dry  Dry fish is not too bueno, so this was  of a downer.

Gumbo -Seafood soup like bouillabaisse or cioppino.  I did not have it but one of our friends did. It looked really, really good.

Etoufee - I thought this was something a bald buy wore as he got older?  Perhaps I will need one soon.  Naw, this is a dish similar to the gumbo, just that it is thicker and more like a stew. Whereas the gumbo has seafood, this one here has either shrimp or something else, was the choice, but it was not  mixed like the gumbo.  Now I did not order this, but man did my friend enjoy it. Very nice.

Sweet Potato Pecan Pie a la mode with ice cream - YOu have to come for the desserts.  This is what the wifey and I ordered, and it was really great. I am going to go back for their Banana Foster Bread Pudding.  Don't be shy, order the dessert!!!

GK says, check this place out for sure! I enjoyed it as a unique dining place. Not sure if it is a frequent place for me yet, however, I am going back for other desserts, so I will let you all know.

2 part review as I ate here twice this week.
1st visit: saw it on Triple D w Guy Fieri just before I flew out here so had to give it a try. 
Lunch: gumbo was good, nice flavors but more sausage and less seafood than I would have liked, excellent garlic bread served with it.
Po'Boy, 1/2 fried oysters, 1/2 fried shrimp: nice size, good flavors, good bread. Sweet tea delicious, freshly made, looking forward to next visit - 4 stars.
2nd visit: Disappointing! Ordered the grilled oysters, they were as small as clams, mentioned it to the waitress but no response, no mgr checked on me, think the complaint died w waitress, way overpriced for 1/2 doz grilled oysters that was the equivalent of 2 decent size oysters. 
Ordered the crab cake, picture shows white lump meat but reality was brown crab mush (shredded crab mixed w spices). 1 1/2 stars.

Délicieux!

I absolutely enjoyed everything from the seafood platter w/soft shell crab for an additional $3 to the shrimp Po' boy. everything was seasoned to perfection! I have the opportunity to order dessert first and indulged in some yummy Banana Foster!!! 

My mother is born and raised in New Orleans and as a stubborn Cajun woman it's hard to please her but even she gave Lola's two thumbs up! My mothers only grip was the mixed greens and the pungent vinegar taste. We shall return for another traditional dish! 10/2

I love a good Po Boy.  Especially ones that have southern or Louisiana attached to it. What other kinds are there?  And I had heard that this place had some good ones.  So I ventured here to try me a shrimp BBQ Po Boy.  Place was a little crowded and the tables are literally right next to each other.

Service was very good despite the crowded house.  I also had an unusual side of cole slaw, can't remember what it was called but it was so good.
The sandwich came and I told the waitress that it should be called the "we don't skimp on the shrimp" po boy.  The shrimp was falling out of the roll.  It was good, but not great.  I felt it lacked a little seasoning or spicyness.

This place is smothered with all things N.O. Saints, if that works for you. The bar is small, only 6-7 bar stools.  Everyone in here seemed to be a local.

I suppose I need to go in to try other things as I'm sure there are better items.  Maybe

Finally had the bronzed catfish today with the gouda grits.  As expected, it was New Orleans in a bowl.  Fantastic dish, I liked it better than the shrimp.

Got the crab dip to start.  This is a fine version of a dip, nothing special.  My wife had the crabcakes.  You get 2 large cakes with the meal, but they are on a bed of greens.  This destroys the purpose, in our estimation, of getting that good crispy exterior, because the lettuce makes the bottoms of the cakes soggy.  Good flavor, a bit too citrusy for me in the sauce.

Underwhelmed, we came here because of the feature on Triple D, I was not impressed . I have had the same dish (etoufee) at other restaurants, once in Texas and several times at the oyster bar @sunset station , both were way better than this place .. sorry :/ . I wanted to like it but the food was bland I had to cover it in Tabasco sauce.  My dates shrimp and grits looked better than they tasted. The tables are too close for my comfort , your pretty much dining with strangers so not the best place to have a date since there's not much privacy in terms of personal space.

Went in for dinner. Be warned, if you hate small spaces, this might not be your spot. The restaurant is pretty intimate and by "intimate" I mean cramped. Anyway, I ordered the crab cake dinner but as soon as I saw it I was already a little disappointed. Judging by the looks I could tell it was mostly breading. The inside tasted fishy and was not appetizing at all. The order comes with 2 cakes but one was burnt on one side, leaving a very bitter taste. Of course they served it with the burnt side down thinking I wouldn't notice. It was inedible to me. In fact, most of the plates came out over cooked and over fried (not just blackened or charred). Service was a little on the slow side and they even moved us to another table when a large group came in. I wasn't impressed at all.

My first time here. Came with a group of 10 people for my friend's birthday. Almost passed it driving by when I got off of the freeway! 

The décor is cute. This is a really tiny hole in the wall, Louisiana themed. I was told by a friend their other location is noticeably bigger. 

My friend ordered the garlic bread and crab & artichoke dip for an appetizer. The bread was really tasty, and I only had one bite of the crab dip, but I would definitely order some for myself next time. I had been eyeing the crawpuppies on the menu, but didn't order them right away. I saw someone else at the table had, so I did eventually order them. They were really good! There is a tiny hint of spice, and they were soft in the middle and crunchy on the outside. Yum. 

I ordered the crab cake dinner for my meal. It's two crab cakes on top of lettuce with some sort of dressing. It was in the shape of two "Ls". Pretty basic. They were tasty, but could have used something else. Not sure what. It didn't come with anything, so I ordered a side of coleslaw, since I love coleslaw. The coleslaw was pretty good. 

My friend ordered the crawfish. He is from Louisiana, and he said it reminded him of home. He ate the whole 2 pounds! It came with 2 potatoes and 2 pieces of corn. It smelled really flavorful. 

I'm not sure why other reviews say the servers are creepy. We had a really nice lady with a broken foot, and she still kicked ass. I liked this place!

Preface:  My wife is originally from LA. So when we travel and I come across a Cajun or Creole restaurant on Yelp, regardless of the ratings she always says "look for someone who is from the south and read their review."  

We got lost finding the place, even with GPS.  Coming south on Charleston be ready to turn right as soon as you cross the freeway.  We missed it and because of construction ended up running around for fifteen minutes trying to get back to the restaurant.  I'm glad we did.

The atmosphere is amazing.  My wife said, "Now this is a New Orleans style kitchen" as soon as she walked in the door and smelled the food and saw the New Orlean Saints Super Bowl banner plastered on the wall.

We had made a reservation through Yelp, we were very quickly seated even though we were early.  The service the whole visit was exceptional.  Our cups never ran dry and our server was great at helping us decide on appetizers and my wife's dessert.

We both ended up getting the D'Brees sandwhich we both had ours dressed a little different but from the first bite to the last it was good food.  My wife made many comments about how it reminded her of home in Louisiana.  I should mention my wife's pregnant and when she finished her sandwhich and saw the dessert menu the first thing out of her mouth was and I seriously quote, "It's a good thing I wore my Maternity Pants."

She ordered a Banana Pudding which came out in a large bowl with a broule'd marshmellow topping.  She pouted when she finished it.

We plan to return again probably during this same trip here in Vegas.  If your looking for great food, amazing service, and a reasonable price this is the place to stop.  It's a very close quick drive from downtown Vegas.

Just like other reviews I saw Lola's on the food network show Diners, drive-in's, and dives and just had to check it out. I went to the Charleston location. The decor was cute and reminded me of New Orleans . Having been to that city several times, I ordered a cup of gumbo with the hushpuppies. The gumbo was decent. In my opinion, I thought it needed to be seasoned just a little bit more but it was edible. The hushpuppies were tasty if you like them fishy. Despite that, the service was good and the food came out quick. I will go back another time, maybe try the Summerlin location to see if my rating changes.
I love love love this place. The food is fantastic and flavorful, and the atmosphere is festive. Just make sure to make a reservation because its popular and small.

This place is awesome, close to my work so a great place to go for a tasty lunch! I've gone several times, and each time the food was excellent! Ive  had the Étouffée, the jambalaya, red beans and rice, the bronzed shrimp with grits, the crab cake appetizer and all were amazing!!!

Came here on a Tuesday night with a bunch of friends. Thank goodness we made reservations cause the place got packed quick and we got the biggest table there.  For starters we all got the craw puppies to share. It was small morsels of tasty crawfish. Crawfish flavor wasn't powerful but you can taste a hint of it. Don't smother it with too much sauce or else that's all you'll taste. Our table got an assortment of things, but I ended up getting the catfish with Gouda grits. I was debating between that and the Shrimp creole. Upon the waitress's recommendation, I went with the catfish. The food came at a relatively slow place. But the kitchen was small and we were the biggest party in the restaurant. My dish was good... The grits are not overwhelming cheesy and the catfish was nice and tender. The dish lacked some texture though. Everything was mushy. Also it lacked some herby freshness... You know when the dish is getting kind of salty and you want something vegetably or herby to cleanse the palate?  It was good but I should have known that this would be a heavy dish. It came with the best toasted bread though. I love the toasted bread with olive oil. My friend got the jumbalaya with shrimp and I really liked his dish. It was spicy and sweet. However I didn't think the shrimp upgrade was worth it. They charge you 4 bucks more for 3 shrimp on top. I also got to try the smoked chicken. It was very moist but I wouldn't order that at a Cajun restaurant. We also shared the sweet potato pecan pie and bananas fosters. Was a little disappointed they don't have beignets. The sweet potato pecan pie was not that amazing. It's like regular pecan pie with a layer of sweet potato. I think you can imagine the flavor. The banana fosters bread pudding was like pure Carmel and brown sugar. I can feel the grittiness of the clumps of sugar in my mouth. Thank god we shared and everyone only had to eat a bite. All in all I like this place but I think some dishes are better than others.
Although it was a small space, the food was amazing. Shrimp and grits seemed to be the most popular. I had the jambalaya and it had a kick to it! So good

Good little find! Felt like I was in NOLA! Food is yummy! We had the Hoppin' John, Crawpuppies, bronzed shrimp, fried catfish, green beans, mustard & turnip greens, potato salad, sweet potato fries and banana pudding!!! A lil bit of errrrthing! We nibbled on it all and left some on the plate...tummy is satisfied!! Cute spot and the service was friendly and quick!!

Gotta get their signature dish, catfish and grits. The fish was a little too spicy for my liking but hey it's Cajun food, so can't complain. The grits were soooo good with Gouda cheese in them. Service was very friendly and quick. One downside is that the actual restaurant is a little small for how popular this place is. But in the end it kinda adds to the atmosphere, especially on a weekend evening. You gotta go!!

My friends and I heard many wonderful things about this place and a friend's birthday was coming up, so we thought it would be a great idea to visit this restaurant on Saturday, March 3rd.  

Let me start by saying that the location could be better.  It's on a very weird intersection on Charleston and in the middle of an awkward strip mall-ish building.  I didn't really get it.  Also, thank goodness we made reservations...there were two tables in the entire restaurant (I'm being fecitious).  All in all, the place offers a very cozy, intimate and homely setting.  We were even greeted by Lola Beth herself.  What a treat!  I must add though that it was hard to say that she was completely welcoming.  Our first impression was that she was a nice lady, however, when talking with her at our table later in the evening, her facial expressions really wasn't as welcoming as we thought.

We decided to order a bunch of items on the menu so that we could put the accolades to the test.  Here's what I tasted:

Crab Cakes- Loved these cakes.  A lot of lump crab meat and not a lot of filler.  The way a crab cake should be.  I loved fact that it sat on a bed of greens and was accompanied with a lemon aioli.  Fantastic combination.  My only criticism is that it was about 6 dollars and included only one cake.  For four people, we ended up getting two orders.  I little pricy in my opinion, but I would pay for that again.

Craw Puppies- To me, I didn't think this appetizer was memorable.  Not something I would choose to order again.  I'm a huge fan of crawfish, but not a fan of hush puppies, so the combination of the two did work for me.  The remoulade did help bring the dish together in the end.

Catfish Po Boy-  I thought this was an excellent choice.  For dinner, I wasn't looking to eat or spend a lot.  Great choice.  For about 11 dollars, I enjoyed a great sandwich.  The bread was grilled nicely.  It wasn't hard or soft where it would become soggy with the lettuce, tomatoes and mayo.  It was perfect.  What sealed the dish for me was the side of fries I had.  Super crispy and super homeade, which made it that much more better.

Sweet Potato Pecan Pie- We did decide to add chantilly cream and that was what made this dessert good. I'm not a fan of pecans. Because of that, I didn't really find myself going back for more.  My hope was that the chantilly cream would help mask the taste of the pecans, but unfortunately, it did not.

Lola's Famous Bread Pudding- Now with bread pudding, I am a HUGE fan. This dessert did NOT disappoint.  SOOOO delicious.  I found myself fighting for the last bit of bread pudding with my friends.  The run praline sauce was superb and although it wasn't offered on the menu, our server was nice enough to suggest also adding the chantilly cream on this dessert.  Such a fantastic combination!

Bananas Foster- Although I didn't admit this to my friends at the time, I had never tried bananas foster before.  This was an "AH-MAZE-ING" first experience.  C'mon!  Brown sugar coated bananas with vanilla bean ice cream.  How could you go wrong!  Each spoonful presented a new pleasant feeling that just ended the evening with a positive experience.  What a great dessert!

All in all, I'd say I had a great time.  I was accompanied with three wonderful friends and discovered a "dive-type" restaurant that offered, for the most part, wonderful Cajun Connections, as their website states.  Being a fan of southern cooking, I will not be opposed returning to try other menu items and of course, Lola's famous bread pudding!

Time to get off the strip and go to a normal restaurant and what a restaurant! I had the Chicken and Sausage Jambalaya  and it was AWESOME!! My girlfriend had the New Orleans Style BBQ Shrimp and they were incredible too!! Overall a REALLY good, off the strip, real world dinner!!!
Awsommmmm poboy beef and black shrimp with grits wow flavorfull must try when you in vegas

Lola's had always come highly recommended by my co-workers from the New Orleans/Laffeyette area so I was eager to try it. I went there with a big group of friends and found it to be as good as I had heard. 

I have a hard time passing up gumbo if it's on the menu, so that is what I ordered here. Although it was made from a darker roux than I have previously had, it was still delicious with a lot of andouille in the mix. I also got a taste of the grilled salmon and fried catfish and found them to be very good. 

Dessert-wise, I can say with all honesty that the Jack Daniels praline sauce that comes with the bread pudding is one of the tastiest confections I have ever had and if I had not been in public and surrounded by 7 of my closest friends and 30 strangers, I would have probably drank the rest of it and licked the plate clean. 

The jambalaya also looked very appetizing and the po' boys menu has piqued my curiosity. I will be returning in the future that's for sure.

Just a word of warning though, Lola's has a higher-end/gourmet style of presentation so if the only experience you have with Cajun/Creole is the pan roasts at Big Al's, you may find the portions to be a bit lighter than what you're used to. However, you will be more than compensated by the quality of the food, ambiance of the restaurant, and the friendliness of the staff.

We had a big group and love the service here. I had the charbroiled oysters which was amazing.  Then I had the shrimp pasta dish that was full of flavor and spicy.  There is nothing I can complain about.  I love it!

Although we were staying at the Vegas strip, I opt for meals outside of the normal franchised big wigs. Now, there is nothing wrong with the franchised restaurants.  I frequent them enough but we like to support mom&pop shops, and local eateries.  Besides, we didn't drive all the way up here to eat at Cheesecake Factory or Buffalo Wild Wings.. come on people!! They're so much out there!!! get out of the strip and venture out.

This find was an absolute bomb idea, and I have to thank my yelppies for directing me to it.  This place is in the outskirts of Downtown Vegas, I would like to say a corner of the industrial district but I don't know the location to well.  It only took us 13 minutes to get there.  Very easy to find and off the freeway.  Plenty of parking and its free!

They open at 11 and already several people were waiting. That's a good sign!  The closed signed turned to open and everyone stood up.  I almost felt the need to rush in and say, hey we got here first.  If you didnt read the sign that says Saints Nation then you wont be surprised. Inside filled of every thing NOLA is about, colors of black, purple, green, yellow, gold, Saints banners, feathers, beads. So if you are really against the NOLA Saints, then go elsewhere but you'll be seriously missing out. The menu has a decent amount of selections.  I was at NOLA this past April and sort of knew what I wanted to try. Pitting NOLA food to Vegas.   I ordered the blackened catfish and grits, my husband ordered the Roast Beef Da Breeze (in the PoBoy section). I also ordered a side of red beans and rice, and 1-crab cake patty.

The food came out fairly quickly, they put my meal in front of me and I was already salivating. I couldn't wait and had a spoon full of the sauce. At first I thought it was rather salty and it took down my excitement down a notch. But as I mixed the sauce with the grits it was perfect! The grits were cheesy but without the sauce, it was missing its seasoning. Combine the two it sings in perfect harmony. Seriously, I enjoyed every bite. I thought, DAM just like NOLAs.  It was so good. I took the rest back to the hotel to eat (even though they didn't have a microwave, I was willing to eat it cold). My husband's PoBoy looked appetizing, and he said it was good. It was slathered with gravy on top. He did say he would prefer the gravy on the side. I didn't taste the poboy since I was really attempting to eat my meal. The red beans and rice, was just okay. The crab cake was very moist, and real crab!!! Would love this in a sandwich. 

The waitress and employees were all very nice, attentive and available for any questions. People from the back that occasional came out for something always came out with a smile. GO GO GO.. well worth it!!

We were brought here by friends from California who frequent Vegas a lot. The New Orleans Style BBQ Shrimp was perfect. The waitress was a sweety and on top of anything we needed. Have been back since and just as good! Look forward to my next visit.

We loved Lola's - and often joke that the food is good enough to merit the cost of the flight. (Probably not, but definitely one of the only places that we'll keep on our 'every time we're in Vegas' list.)

His plate: Roast Beef Debris
Her plate: Chicken and Sausage Jambalaya

One of the better Jambalayas I've had, made even better by the house-made jalapeno hot sauce. Not too hot, TONS of flavor. Perfectly cooked rice, excellent sausage, just plain great overall.

D loved his sandwich - chosen because it's what Yelp suggested, and Guy had when he visited. Great flavor, excellent sauces.

We'll be back for more!

Celebrated a birthday at Lola's and our party was a group of 5. The food was delicious and the service was great. The waiting time between apertizer and main course was perfect. The price of food and drinks was just right. The only suggestion for improvement is that the restaurant needs to replace the chairs. Main chairs had rips in them.

Lola's - best Louisiana style food I've had. Even when I've been to Louisiana. 

I love to get crab cakes anywhere I go, and this place has some of the best I've ever had. They were large, crispy and cooked just perfect in the inside. I can't even begin to tell you enough of how much I adore crab cakes. I just can't. My head might explode. 
I also had the Shrimp Caesar salad and had the shrimp blackened. Amazing. The Caesar dressing was so thick and creamy, but not too rich. 
Shrimp and Grits. Let me tell you, I have never been a fan of grits, but I made an exception, and I was patting myself on the back for doing so. Very creamy, nice and garlicky and the shrimp were huge! ( Had them blackened as well. ) 

Also, they have Abita beers. Purple Haze is a great one that's light and tasty.

The service was very quick and friendly and I will go there as much as humanly possible for my splurging days.

Had a great lunch. Etoufee was well done, good consistency and flavor. Jambalaya was also the right amount of everything. Finished it off with Bananas Foster bread pudding. Our taste journey down creole lane was awesome!!!! Try this quaint place you wont be disappointed.

Amazing food! Had the red beans & rice and jambalaya! Gotta try it! Cajun at its finest! Couldn't find the new Summerlin location on Yelp but u gotta check it out! We sat on the outside patio In the afternoon and it was perfect! It's a great restaurant with really amazing staff! I don't normally post reviews but occasionally u meet the nicest people and get the best service so it deserves a good mention! Make sure u ask for "FARAH" when u you there. She's possibly the nicest server we've ever met! She's sharp, professional, and great with the guests! Because of her and the food, we will definitely be back and we will refer Lola's to all our friends! Way to go guys!

If you can't visit New Orleans, let New Orleans come to you! Everything from the interior to the menu made me miss the Big Easy. And boy, do I love NOLA. Lola's is pretty unique when it comes to dining near DTLV. Nothing about it reminds you of The Strip. It's understated, casual, and fairly easy to score a reservation. 

I took my parents here for a belated b-day dinner in January. It was a weeknight and I wasn't looking to spend big bucks on a meal. Lola's takes reservations on Yelp and, as I said before, kind of a unique gem near downtown. Not your typical strip mall or casino eatery.

We started with oysters and crawpuppies. And for an entree we tried etoufeee as well as gumbo. All of the food was cooked well and came out quickly. All of this paired well with an Abita beer or glass of chilled white wine. 

As it got later into the evening, the restaurant started filling up quickly and was getting loud. Being that I was with my parents who are older and hardly "party people", we ordered dessert to-go and made it an early night.

Overall, I'd recommend Lola's to anyone looking for a relatively authentic NOLA meal way outside the south. Also, for folks looking to have a "normal" dining experience in Las Vegas, this is a solid spot to pick.
Closest you can get to Louisiana cooking in Vegas, just as good as I've had in Louisiana. If you are in Vegas Lola's is a place to check out.

I've spent lots of time in New Orleans and this place certainly has brought the southern spiced food flare to Vegas.  We started with the Craw Puppies appetizer and gumbo...perfect combo to get the cajun spices flowing in our mouths.  The gumbo lacked a little flavor but it was still good.  I had the grits and shrimp dish for an entre...absolutely perfect.  The grits were done just right surrounded with andoulle sausage in a mushroom sauce topped with 8 thick shrimp...deeelicious!  Lastly, the pumpkin bread pudding for dessert was cat's meow!  The small atmosphere, service,  and food are wonderful assets to Vegas.  It's close to downtown and only a 10 minute cab ride from the strip.  If you're in town,  put it on your list.

This place is so wonderful. I love southern/cajun food. I've been here twice and every time I leave I can't wait to come back and try something new. Crawpuppies are divine and I am not a fan of hush puppies at all. The crawfish really adds another dimension of flavor to the traditional dish. Had a cup of gumbo and the only bad part about it was that I didn't order a bowl. Just a hint of spice so you know it's there, but not overwhelming. Perfect on a cold day. My boyfriend has tried their chili dog po' boy. I'd say skip it. The bread is the best part, but a chili dog is a chili dog. I had a platter with a little bit of their seafood choices. It did not disappoint. Catfish is cooked to perfection; it is some flaky moist goodness. The mussels we heavenly. Easily the best thing on my plate. Crab cakes were good, but nothing to write home about. My friend ordered the shrimp & grits and it was creamy goodness. If you've ever wanted to try it or you're already a fan order it. Now on to dessert. I saw bananas foster on the menu and that is what made me drag everyone here with me. (and reasons I have gone back since) Who doesn't love bananas, with buttery, sweet, sugary sauce and vanilla bean ice cream? Probably the same people that enjoy clubbing baby seals. If I was on death row and had to place my order for my last meal bananas foster from Lola's would be part of that order. Only bad thing about this place is the size of the dining area. I imagine it gets packed at peak times, but trust me it's worth it.

I have been wanting to try here for a while. The location is fairly small. The food was great, My boyfriend had the gumbo and I had the fettuccine alfredo with blackened shrimp. Very yummy. We, also, split a crab cake which was delicious and one of the best I have ever had.

Actually came here yesterday with my boyfriend. It was his first time! We ordered crawpuppies for an appetizer and he got a fried catfish po boy and I got the shrimp n grits. Everything was delicious and my boyfriend was so excited that they had Abita beer.

What a gem! This places respects those who make reservations so make sure to get one as they are quite busy. The restaurant is small but has some personality. The Fleur de Lys and mardi gra beads make an appearance. They have an open grill in the front of the restaurant which was pretty cool since the servers grill up oysters and garlic bread for guests. I want you to know that it has been a very long time since I have enjoyed a restaurant from start to finish. I enjoyed everything at this place. This place serves Louisiana brews. I ordered a strawberry lager which was AMAZING! If you like the Sam Adams Cherry wheat you are bound to be impressed. For starters we had the Crawpuppies, mmm these things are a must try! Entrees, I had the signature shrimp and grits and my husband had the DDD featured roast beef sandwich, both were delicious. With the appetizer and entrees being so good my husband and I could not think of skipping dessert even though we were stuffed. We ordered the banana's foster bread pudding, oh my! This was other worldly. It just sealed the deal, we will be back for sure!

Lola's is a must for us every time we are in LV. We didn't have reservations but we're able to sit at the bar. I had the catfish and grits with Gouda cheese yum yum. My husband had red beans and rice with sausage. It's a little too spicy for me but he loved it. The garlic bread OMG. Can't say enough about this place. Love love love it!

Your review helps others learn about great local businesses.

Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.
Food was great , good service at the worst table in the house at 5pm. Hostess essentially told me that was the table near the back door in the corner.  Every employee arriving at work went through a lengthy check in directly behind/next to us. The employees put their purses etc in the cabinet behind one changed shoes at the check in station.  The hostess told me half the room was closed an the corner was the only option.

Finally made it down to Lola's!

We went with the Charbroiled Oysters to start :

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lolas-las-vegas?userid=eZZyuJDouIg4p-GYB3PV_A#2KX0qqRWWzza4lvTzNQ1cw

They are dressed with Garlic, Lemon, and a blend of cheeses! These were pretty good!  Not mind blowing but good at around $12-13 if I remember correctly.

I went with the Blackened Shrimp Poboy on New Orleans French Bread! 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lolas-las-vegas?select=-rgLE3shfCXIeA1fprAIGg#09IBYP8kA8h-iBcCyldMuA

Great sandwich...just wish the shrimp were a little larger taking into consideration the price, but they were cooked well and had tons of flavor!  For some odd reason, I was served my sandwich without my fries though...they came later, after I took my time taking pics of both entrees, eating bites of both entrees, and starting on my second half of the sandwich, the fries finally came.  I did like the seasoning on them though...slight cajun salt style on some "well done" cooked fries.

The Bronzed Catfish and Grits : 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lolas-las-vegas?userid=eZZyuJDouIg4p-GYB3PV_A#26bezKK4tDMzoxIcy2zvdA

Fresh Catfish, Bronzed, over Smoked Gouda Grits with Andouille Sausage and Mushroom Ragout. Cooked well and very yummy! Would recommend it!  Portions were a bit small in comparison to other cajun/southern style places we have been to in town though, and the prices were not cheap (not expensive either) in that reflection, but still good.

For dessert, there was a miscommunication...we wanted the Banana Foster Bread Pudding but got the regular banana fosters instead :

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lolas-las-vegas?userid=eZZyuJDouIg4p-GYB3PV_A#2nBYfnTojNkJf_zpe0iAoQ

It was good, but not nearly as good as the bread pudding! 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lolas-las-vegas?userid=eZZyuJDouIg4p-GYB3PV_A#6VaYCDgiODV53TnSZylS_A

It is made of Banana Bread / Bread Pudding, fresh Bananas, Vanilla Bean Ice Cream and Fosters Sauce! Very very good!! This was the highlight of the night for me!  The top of the ice cream had a slight creme brulee like crisp on it too!

Small complaint.  When we saw that we received the wrong intended dessert, we told the server and she ordered us the right one.  We had a bite or two of the wrong dessert thinking there might be some bread pudding hiding in there, but we quickly realized it was the wrong order.  They never took the wrong dessert off the table, so we ended up picking at it a bit, but still left at least 70% of the dessert on the table.  When the tab came through, we got charged for both.  I didn't complain or say anything, but the server asked us if we ate any of the wrong item, and I said we picked at it, but left most of it on the table.  She then offered to pay half of the plate costs $4 of the $8...

If this was almost at any other restaurant in town, the wrong order would have been comped.  If I would have raised a fuss, it would have been comped.  But because I didn't do that, Lola's paid for half..take it for what you will.

Overall, I can recommend this place, but the price/portion ratio isn't as solid as some of the other Cajun/Southern style spots in town, and the food was good, but not mind blowing good like Cajun spiced food should be!  A very solid 3 star spot in my book.

90/100 challenge

Service was super slow. We were waiting for at least a good hour for our food and there were no updates or apologies for the slow service. We were also probably the last people to leave for the night. I think we got in around 8pm, we didn't leave til about 10pm. It's a good thing the food made up for the service. I ordered the jumbalaya and my boyfriend ordered the gumbo. His friend ordered the chicken strips with fries. Overall, we really enjoyed our food. The jumbalaya had quite a kick to it. It was really spicy. I tasted some of the gumbo and it was also quite tasty. Prices were reasonable considering it is Vegas and off the strip.

A few things to note. My boyfriend and his friend are both blind. He doesn't need you to help him put a straw in his cup, especially when he says that he is fine. Please don't assume someone needs or wants your help just because they have a disability. Ask before doing. I know you just want to help but trust me the person will appreciate it more if you ask before helping them.

If the service was faster, I'd probably give this place a higher rating. It was also a little bit tucked away. Our Uber driver had to make a Uturn.

The food is delicious! The charleston location is a small quaint place. Been there several times for lunch and that stays packed! Not even exaggerating. The service is eh. Honestly took them a while to fill my water cup several times, but when you are packed like they are, I can see the reason for iffy service.
I definitely love the food. I am from Louisiana and I can vouch for the flavor in their food. Definitely from back home. Go and get some shrimp and grits! That ragout sauce will make you wish there was more. And their poboys are worth a second or third try. 

I can't wait to return!

This place is bomb. jambalaya, gumbo, chicken strips and sweet tea! Wow so good grate fun place with good clean environment. Staff more then friendly... I really enjoyed my food and my experience. I felt like I was in a really neat and fun secret place that maybe only the locals know about and it was fantastic.
Food is mediocre and overpriced. Staff is friendly though. Do not get the gumbo. Worst I've ever had.
The Banana Fosters Bread Pudding is AWESOME!!!! The owners and servers were the best!!!

Saw lolas one day riding my motorcycle with the wife. We stopped in and it was an absolute diamond in the rough. The food was excellent. The atmosphere was second to none. Thank you for making this a go to place for a date night.
Great food, good prices, relaxed atmosphere, great service, a highlight of our trip to Vegas

This place is always jam-packed and for a damn good reason. The food is always great and the atmosphere is fun. I've had the jambalaya, étouffée, crab cakes, oysters, shrimp po boys, roast beef debris, and of course the banana foster bread pudding which reigns supreme. If you are a beer lover they also have many versions of New Orleans own beer, Abita. The only downside is the parking which can be a pain. Everyone should definitely try this place out, Lola is also opening a new place in Summerlin soon and I can't wait to get there.

Came to have dinner by myself...... Been wanting gumbo for years. The place is in an area that seems sketchy but once i got into the parking lot it wasn't so bad.
Tried a cup of their gumbo which was good and it hit the spot, proceeded to order the shrimp and grits which was amazing. I'm glad I made a stop here and waiting on my dessert!!! 
The staff was really nice and even though the place was busy they were attentive.

I've been to Lola's at least twice now and I really enjoy the catfish po' boy! The atmosphere is nice with a bit of hussle and bussle. The second time I was there I sat in the outdoor seating area and they were doing a photo shoot for some of the food they have. Ended up getting some free oysters for appetizer before the meal. They were great and probably tasted even better because they were free :-). I definitely look forward to coming here again.
It's a small but very hospitable place. Their bread is amazing. Food is awesome...I will recommend this place to anyone
Im from Houston and I know real cajun food living right next door to Louisiana....This is Certified Cajun Food! I would fly back just to eat here again!!

I'm so excited there's some authentic New Orleans cooking now in Las Vegas! The place is cute and family owned-operated. My extended family all lives in New Orleans so I'm quite familiar with the cuisine. I'm also a very harsh critic! 

*$4.25 - cup of gumbo. She puts sausage, chicken AND seafood in her gumbo. I found it heavy on the chicken and light on the seafood. The flavor was great. Really took me back to NOLA! Basically was a chicken/sausage flavored gumbo with a couple shrimp thrown in.
*$11.99 - 1/2 dozen charbroiled oysters. *sigh* I'm pretty spoiled here. I didn't find these nearly as good as real new orleans charbroiled oysters, but they were still enjoyable
*$9.99 - Shrimp poboy with fries. The poboy was a little small compared to what I'm used to , but otherwise it was perfect. They fly their bread in from new orleans and the shrimp were so delish! The best poboy I've ever had outside of nola!

Overall I'll be back. Their dessert menu looked incredible (bananas foster, bread pudding!). Prices weren't bad ($7.99-$12.99 per entree). Service was polite and speedy. Give them a try Yelp!

In Vegas there's so many restaurants to choose from. But because of my fellow Yelpers we gave this highly rated spot a try. We were blown away that the food was so good and the spices was so close to New Orleans Style. For starters, we had the crab cake and the craw puppies. Unfortunately, you only get one crab cake. Then ordered the BBQ shrimp and the shrimp creole which had just the right seasoning. Food was delicious but could increase the portions. The atmosphere is nice and waitress was nice. I recommend getting there when they're opening. It gets crowded fast with the people who work in the area.

My first and last experience at Lola's had problems different than I have read others post before dining here.

We went at an off-peak time of the afternoon so there was no wait and the attending server seemed nice enough, nothing more.

However, when the po'boy came I asked "where the seafood was" ????
The server replied with some sort of typical number of ounces that are placed on each sandwich. As if there was a government agency in their kitchen certifying each and every sandwich leaves with precisely the correct and accurate amount....hmmmm.

As some previous reviewers said, plan to eat before you go here whether it be the wait or the tiny amount of food. 

No, we were hoping to find a great place for Cajun but........ "THIS AIN'T IT"!

Okay . . . I'll be honest . . . almost missed this place . . . it is tucked in between businesses that had I not looked at the right time I would have missed it.  Upon entering . . . I was greeted promptly . . . and chose to seat at the small bar as to not take up a whole table for my party of one.

I asked the waitress what she would recommend . . . and she point out a few choices that were diners favorites . . . and I forgot to mention were featured on Triple D.  And sure enough after she told me that . . . I noticed the picture of Guy on the wall.

Anyways . . . I ordered the crab cake and a fried oyster po-boy . . . the crab cake was full of crab and had this great sauce the was so tasty that I finished the bed of green the cake was sitting on since it was covered with this delightful sauce . . . the po-boy was also very good, crispy oysters a nice roll and again a wonderful sauce.

To say 
I am now a fan would be an understatement . . . I made reservations for tomorrow . . . this place could not wait for a return trip to Las Vegas.
Make reservations so you don't wait awhile.

The food here is amazing!  I fell in love with the New Orleans Style BBQ Shrimp.  My group and I had the Crab Cake, Crab and Artichoke Dip, Crawpuppies, Sweet Potato Fries and Bread Pudding.  All were excellent.  If you love Cajun food go here.

I loveeeeeee NOLA. This place reminds me so much of the food back in the french quarter. You must have the charbroiled oysters. They are buttery and a good amount of garlic. The best part you dip their grilled french bread in the oyster juice and WOW I'm already craving it now haha. The blackened catfish and grits are so good and the fish is flaky and the best part is the grits arn't bland. You also gotta have abita beer which is from nola with your meal. The owner Lola is always there with her husband cooking and entertaining guests. This place is super small and it's off of the 15 on charleston. It is right by the premium outlet malls. It gets pretty busy at night so it's good to make a reso.

Went here for dinner with some Canadian friends visiting from Toronto.  Turned out the place was packed!!  Food was delicious - ordered shrimp and grits, gumbo, jambalaya, and a creole dish.   The CrawFish were the last day in season and were awesome.  Hard to believe I used to catch and use those critters as fish bait for large mouth bass.    Overall delicious!!   Would recommend and return for sure.
Ate here last night.  Busy, great service, wonderful Louisiana fare.  Bread pudding is the best!

Dinner out with my two favorite men. Food was good as usual however young hostess wouldn't stop arranging her tits.REALLY!  I was really annoyed that my husband was subjected to the view. Another thing she shouldn't chew gum(gives her a dumb look) . On the good side our waitress was fabulous. Don't know her name.

This is, without a doubt, the best Cajun food I have had outside of south Louisiana.  It felt like home walking into the restaurant, small hole in the wall, nothing fancy.  The food was great, served hot and reasonable time.  The Shrimp & Gouda Grits were amazing.  It was amazing to find real Leidenheimer french bread outside of southern La.  Tried three desserts, all were great:  Bread pudding, Choclate Cake & the Fig Cake.  Will try the Banna's Foster Bread Pudding next time.  This place is on my 5 Star list and I'm a Foodie.

It has been one of those nights when I was hungry but couldn't figure out what I was hungry for.  Looking back on recent trips, I decided I want some New Orleanian food.  So, off to Lola's I went.  The place was busy (always a good sign) and I was greeted by a friendly server.  With all the fleur de lis, Abita logo, paintings of antebellums...I was in Saints country without a doubt.  I sat under Guy Fieri's signed picture.

I got a sweet tea (as I should) and my sister ordered some char-grilled oysters.  According to her, they were good but not similar to Acme Oyster House's grilled oysters.  Since I'm allergic to shellfish, I have to believe it.  She had the shrimp and grits and she loved it.  I like their grits too...really cheesy!  I got the roast beef debris po' boy with fries (featured on Guy Fieri's show on the Food Network: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives).  My fries were salty so I had to dust off the salt and dip them in lots of ketchup.  They're like the fries from Five Guys but 3 times the salt.

For dessert, we had the sweet potato pecan pie and the BANANAS FOSTER BREAD PUDDING.  The pie was quite good.  The bread pudding with the homemade caramel sauce was out of this world - I don't recommend sharing it.

They have oysters, po' boys, sweet potato, bananas foster, sweet tea, gumbo, étouffée, gumbo...all they need are beignets and alligator.

When my father was in town we decided to pay homage to my hometown state of Louisiana and with the crisp, chilly weather ghosts of Gumbo past had me cravin' cajun. I've had Lola's bookmarked for a long time and based on Yelp reviews, it seemed legit. 

Walking in, I noticed a stack of King Cakes and Louisiana paraphernalia decorated the walls (beads, fleur de lys, Bourbon Street signs, and Saints flags). I felt like I had stepped into a restaurant in the French Quarter, it was small and quaint. Recommendations are strongly recommend. My father and I lucked out and were seated at a hi-top table near the bar. 

Our server came over and greeted us with a smile and warm, "Hey y'all! What can I get you to drink while y'all are lookin' over the menu?" authentic accent and all. (Seriously, it's a portal to Louisiana and Southern hospitality.) I ordered a sweet tea (which is SO hard to find West of the Mississippi - besides Texas) and our drinks were ordered promptly arrived with warm, freshly buttered and flashed grilled bread. We both ordered a cup of Gumbo and we're still narrowing down our choices.

The Gumbo arrived with lightning speed & was on point. It was thick (a lot of people think it's a soup, but it's very much like a stew) and filled with chunks (not bits) of Andouille sausage, shrimp, chicken, and okra. Tasted like home; it was excellent.

For entrees we ordered Crawfish Etouffee (my FAVORITE Cajun dish of all-time) and Shrimp Creole. The etouffee was amazing, the butter, garlic, and green pepper flavors well balanced and there was just the right amount of heat. The good times we're definitely being had by my mouth. Shrimp Creole was also amazing, tomato-y, peppery, garlicky, onion-y paradise. The shrimp were also huge (love me some oximorons). I found out that their shrimp, crawfish, and catfish were flown in from Louisiana. At this point we were way too full to try dessert. I am planning a second trip back to explore more of menu and to give that Banana's Foster Bread Pudding. 

I got to live the Louisiana state motto: "Come fall in Love with Louisiana all over again" on my trip to Lola's. It's great to know that there is great Creole & Cajun cuisine just around the corner. Excellent service. Standout, authentic food! A warm, friendly atmosphere. Laissez les bon temps roulezer in your mouth at Lola's!

weird location... small and quaint.  heard great things so we decided to go...

we sat inside, the outside seating has too much traffic noise. when we sat down the service was fast and friendly.  

they gave us complimentary bread which was garlicky and crisp and good.
we ordered the crawfish hushpuppies...to die for!!! served with a yummy creamy sauce...i could have just ate these all day!!! best thing i ate there.

i ordered the chicken and sausage jambalaya with cajun shrimp added.  the shrimp were spicy delicious and so dang good!  i should have just ordered that with rice.  the jambalaya was filled with lots of andouille sausage and chicken, it was spicy and good.. .but very heavy and filling.  i had a lot left.

we also ordered the red beans and rice... it was creamy and delicious. 

i will definitely go again, next time i'll get 2 orders of the hushpuppies and just the cajun shrimp... mmmmm.

The place is SMALL, I definitely reccomend calling ahead for a reservation.  We ordered the dressed poor boy, it just fell flat, didn't really have too much flavor and I did not enjoy the mustard dressing at all.   Some other folks in my party ordered other items from the menu and I didn't see anything I would come back to try.  

We had the banana foster bread pudding, we really enjoyed it.  

The crab artichoke dip with the toasted bread was tasty unfortunately I wouldn't come back just for dessert or appetizer.

I wish I had taken photos of my meal.. But the dishes never lasted long enough to snap! What an amazing find! The oysters were the best I ever had.. "Charbroiled". The crawfish my boyfriend are was authentic and spicy. My grilled mandarin chicken bowl... Had a nice presentation .. Real grilled chicken and a little spicy which was nice. So good!! Thanks Heather for the excellent service!

I'd give them a 3.5 if I was able to. It's an easy place to miss but it's worth the stop for a bite of decent food. We are in Vegas for another weekend and as I almost always do, I Yelp every business I think of trying to see what my fellow Yelper's have experienced. In this case, I couldn't help but see (or taste) for myself to find out which reviews I could identify with. Bottom line, as it has been stated "The food is GOOD, but not GREAT". I 100% agree with this statement.

I took photos of the food we had except for the wings and Red Beans & Rice I missed those. We had a sampler of items; Gumbo, Red Beans & Rice, Jambalaya, Chargrilled Oysters, Craw-puppies, Cajun Hot Wings & Bread Pudding. How was it? The Red Beans & Rice was good and so was the Bread Pudding. The wings at a #8 level of spiciness was indeed spicy but flavorful. As far as the other items...well, I wouldn't order the Gumbo again, not that it wasn't good, the taste was just off for me and I also thought it lacked seafood; mine had half of a shrimp tail as I recall. The overall taste was ok but having had gumbo in so many places including New Orleans , I'd have to say, in comparison, the gumbo at Lucille's has better taste than Lola's. The  Craw-puppies; two (2) issues -cost to food ratio and taste; you get four (4) bite size (literal bite size) pieces for $5.29, I wouldn't order it again, the crawfish wasn't the main ingredient, it was moist breading with a strong mayo/mustard combo taste. For the very small size and qty, I thought it would be packed with crawfish and be bursting with flavor but it was not and did not. The Jambalaya was ok, my husband liked it enough -for me, it didn't have the tomato and seasonings infused to the rice taste but more like seasoned tomatoes sauce that was stirred in. I did enjoy the taste of the Chargrilled Oysters, they were deeeelicious, the most flavorful of all of what we tried and you get toasted french bread with it which is a plus in my book -the negative: the actual oysters were really tiny. Also, the cost for that size; $12.99 for six (6), is not worth the money because there wasn't much of the oysters to be had. I would order it again if the oysters themselves are bigger because they were good.

Lastly, the service. I read some reviews that said the people were awkward and they just sort of stared at you...I didn't experience that at all. The woman that was our server was very nice and pleasant and checked on us often. If we needed anything, any server walking by was glad to help. I felt the service was pretty good.

If you haven't been to Lola's, stop in. It's good food with good service.
The shrimp an grits are fabulous.  I come here every couple of months, an always order the same thing.  Get the shrimp and grits....trust me.

Food was pretty good took my mom for her Birthday to try something new my girlfriend got the gumbo it was okay. My mom got grilled catfish she enjoyed hers and I got the shrimp and grits. The food was seasoned okay for a restaurant standard not what I was expecting the food wasn't as spicy as I thought it would be since it was Louisiana creole cookong. Guess I went in expecting it to be like what I have had in Louisiana but that taste is hard to imitate. All in all I enjoyed the food though I will go back to try a Po'Boy sandwich since that is what they were on Triple D for.

Sign on the door says closed until further notice.  More than a little annoying 

It does look like had a health department inspection this week, don't know if it is related

Excellent food with many gluten free options. Also,
the food is reasonably priced. The staff is friendly and will make great suggestions.

Pretty disappointing. I was really expecting some authentic Louisiana type food. It was but it just wasn't good. The gumbo was way too thick, as thick as gravy and everything else was just barely ok. I hated the crawpuppies, they were nothing like hush puppies at all. I will not be returning.

Without a doubt Lolas Louisiana kitchen is outstanding. I had the bronze shrimp and grits with garlic green beans and the bacon greens and a crabcake and I have to tell you it was some of the best southern cooking I've ever had.  I would recommend to anyone who lives here in Las Vegas or anyone visiting Las Vegas to visit Lolas Louisiana kitchen you will not be disappointed.

If you pass I'm going to Lola's you have missed out on great food!

Absolutely delicious food. Small, lively restaurant. The staff is very friendly and attentive. Not a great selection of beers, but the menu is carefully manned. We enjoyed a crab cake, a cup of Gumbo and Chhupapoulas with a fried catfish. Great.

I really wanted to give this restaurant a great review. The first time I came to this restaurant was about three years ago and I left disappointed.
