I ordered the shrimp and grits and it was plain and just not very good. A little less than two years ago, I went to New Orleans and had fantastic food. We went to very good restaurants and had everything from barbecue shrimp to Gouda grits to gumbo and more. It was all absolutely delicious. I loved it. Due to this, I thought... Let's give this restaurant another try. Well... I'm sorry I did. 
Lola's is terrible in comparison to the quality of food that I had in New Orleans. I ordered the shrimp and grits again. Grits should be smooth, not lumpy, and just taste like heaven. The grits at Lola's were lumpy, pasty, and the consistency was that of a dish that was left out for a few hours and has therefore hardened rather than being smooth. The taste is not very good and leaves a lot to be desired. In fact, there is a diner with a few restaurants here in town that makes grits 10 times better than Lola's. The shrimp was plain and I would not order it again. My friend ordered the barbecue shrimp with rice and did not even finish the dish because it was just OK yet she would not order it again nor would she want to come back here again. She was disappointed. We did order the fried okra as a starter and it was not bad but it was not anything to write home about. The best part of our meal was the garlic bread! Pretty sad.
We did not even bother ordering dessert.
Lola's is not a restaurant I would recommend to anyone who asks me about great Louisiana food because I have tasted way better.
The service was OK. It was slow at times.
I know that this restaurant was on DDD's, which I'm not at all impressed by, yet I think that is where a lot of the hype comes in.
I was hoping that after going to New Orleans, where we stayed several days and ate a lot of great food, I would appreciate this restaurant more. It in fact did the opposite. Maybe this is what home cooked meals are supposed to look like, which aren't very good if that is the case, but this is not at all great restaurant quality top-of-the-line New Orleans quality food and I will not be going back.

Once again I think expectation management may be an issue for me when trying highly reviewed restaurants on Yelp. I ordered the shrimp and grits and while the shrimp was good, it was not over the top awesome. The zydeco music and Abita beer was a nice touch. I had the banana fosters bread pudding for dessert and it lived up to its billing. I think if the bill for my meal had been under $30 for one beer, the shrimp & grits, and the bread pudding I may have had a better experience.

I lived in New Orleans for over six years with many a return trip for the food and Lola's does an OUTSTANDING job of presenting those good, rich and full flavors in a venue I'd expect to find in Mid-City or Uptown!   My bronzed catfish with andouille and mushroom was amazing and totally made my night!

Delicious restaurant from beginning to end. They even had a yummy strawberry beer on tap that had me excited to order dinner. I got the Roast Beef D'Brees which had the most tender roast beef I've ever had. Then our dessert was the Bananas Foster Bread Pudding. HOLY CRAP. For never eating bread pudding before, I must say I have been missing out. The ice cream and warm bread pudding was the perfect combo of hot and cold. To die for. Do not miss out on this gem when you go to Vegas.

wait, i didn't review this place yet? well, it deserves some love. 

I really love this place whenever we go to Vegas. It's off the strip and across from the LV outlets in the old Bakery (and i forgot the name). Very small and cute but it's quite the gem. On my first try, I had the Bronzed Catfish which was awesome, yet a bit on the greasy side. The grits underneath were so good with it. We've also had the crawfish hush puppies and I've had the Sweet Tea. Crawfish Crabcakes are awesome too! Pretty cool place which you don't expect in Vegas. It's hard to find good Cajun/Creole food anywhere west of the Mississippi, but this rates up there.

Aside from the awesome food at this place, the service is awesome.  We were in LV in September for a tradeshow and hit this place on our last night.  We were the last to be seated, so by the time we were done, the restaurant was closing up.  We had taken a cab from our hotel, but had no way back since apparently cabs can no longer be hailed in LV.  The hostess called a cab company for us, and then called again when they didn't arrive.  All of the staff was friendly and spoke to us while we waited.  After waiting for nearly an hour and still no cab, our waitress drove us home!!!  She was so sweet - waitress - I'm so sorry I can't remember your name - but you were awesome for doing that!  She took us all the way to our hotel front door and wouldn't accept any money for gas (but I hope you found that $10 we left in the backseat!)  Thank you Thank you Lolas and staff!  We will come back every year for sure!

I am very happy that we finally gave Lola's a try!! This place has been on my radar for a while now.

I came here with my grandma and my daughter around 5pm on Saturday and we had zero wait time. The restaurant is a little small but it is super cute. Also, walking up to the door my 8 yr old kept saying how good it smelled. The restaurant started to fill up quickly but it was ok because our food came out already by then. 

We had the crawfish hush puppies as an appetizer and enjoyed them a lot, especially the dipping sauce. 

My daughter ordered a cup of gumbo and she LOVED it! 

I had the trio with red beans and rice, gumbo and crawfish ettouffe and my grandma ordered the same. My favorite by far was the red beans and rice. I was very happy with that and felt like I should have just ordered that. The gumbo and ettouffe was good too but I love the beans and rice. Oh yeah, the buttered bread is amazing too. 

We also ordered banana pudding to go but I haven't tried it yet because I am so full lol. 

I plan on coming back and trying to charbroiled oysters and maybe a po' boy. 

This place is legit.

Love love love the bronzed catfish and grits! I go to vegas alot for business and before even checking in at the hotel we hit Lolas! Service is awesome but I will say not any of the normal servers were there last time and with my tattoos and casual look I didn't get the great service we are used to having I think because other folks who look like they tip well we're being served alot faster and more often checked on.. I do tip very well so that was a big mistake. But I still love lolas and will be back often!

First time coming to Lola's, and I must say it's the next best thing to New Orleans food you gonna get in the desert...Ordered the fried shrimp poBoy and Char broiled oysters...food was great..my girl ordered the jambalaya, spicy but good. .If you can't make it to New orleans, its the next best thing. Service was friendly and nice. We went in the middle of the week during lunch hours, we were sitted right away and our order came out quick. Oh btw our server was Jennifer she was awesome!!

First time eating catfish.  Service was good, ordered catfish and grits ... very tasty (but, found that catfish was not my favorite fish) HOWEVER, Lola's Bread Pudding w/ vanilla ice cream was fantastic.  Go for the fish and stay for the Bread Pudding!

If you're looking for Cajun-styled food, this is definitely the place to go to in Vegas. The food tasted so authentic and delicious, both entrees and dessert! Also, our waitress Lisa was incredibly friendly and polite! I would come back to this place again just for their customer service!

Mrs. Fishstick suggested this place......so I went.

Food was delicious.  Honestly if you don't like this place.....do yourself a favor and go treat yourself to a $1 menu cheeseburger somewhere because that is the type of food your palette desires.  However, if you enjoy good food, southern food in particular, this little place won't let you down.  We had:

1.  Crabcake - crisp on the outside, moist (Mrs. Fishstick hates that word) on the inside with a spicy remolaude.  

2.  Crawpuppies - crisp little balls of crawfish, breading and seasoning with an adequate dipping sauce.

3.  Softshell crab poboy - two softshell crabs fried GBD.  We had to ask for extra mayo but they were very tasty.

4.  Shrimp n grits - AMAZING.  The shrimp n grits here are among the best entrees I've had in Vegas.  A feat in itself was getting Mrs. Fishstick to eat them.  She was reluctant to try saying "I don't like grits" but these white, creamy gems are akin to something else of similar description she enjoys a lot so I insisted she tried.  And......she liked them!!!

Good job Lola's Louisiana Kitchen.  Excellent food!!!

1st time here. Food was excellent. Had crab cake and sizzling ham po boy. Both were great. Banana foster dessert was delicious. Definitely would come back. Only bad thing food took a little longer than expected. Not quick but worth the wait.

Sorry, but this place was disgusting. I got the shrimp and grits and it was a bowl full of oil. There was also barely any flavor to anything, and that's the antithesis of what Creole food should taste like. My friend got the fried chicken and his was much better than mine, but why is fried chicken the better option at a Creole place? Still looking in Vegas for something better.

The food here was delicious.  Had a D-Brese and shrimp and grits.  For dessert we had bananas foster bread pudding.  We had good service and the food was great. I am knocking off a start because we had to sit in the hallway and it was hot (112 outside and maybe 90 inside).  We were told is was air-conditioned but all we saw were fans.  The fan closest to us was removed to bring in a party of 6. You need a reservation!
I had BBQ shrimp!!!! OMG sooo spicy and delish a must try for sure.  Our waitress was very nice and informative .  My friend had jambalaya pretty freaking good.  Banana pudding was the shiz!!!!

This spot is must visit if your in vegas.  It's close to downtown and the strip of Charleston.   Reservations are encouraged.  Loved the service that we received even though we arrived 40min before close.  Food is delicous.  Will be back again.

Finally.  My "Cajun Quest" is meeting better results.  Located in what used to be the old Holsum Bakery, Lola's was not too far out, and I was definitely more on track to getting (for me) what the flavor should be like.  Yes, I am picky when it comes to my Southern type food.

I had a nice lunch here last week.  A small one, but it worked.  I tried their gumbo, and it was good.  I thought it was nice and meaty, but I wanted just a little more flavor.  Overall, I did like it.  I think a shot of Tabasco would have gone a long way, but that's on me.

The jambalaya, however, was some seriously good stuff.  THAT got my face a little flushed, and I scarfed that down with gusto.

The place itself is respectable.  Nice little patio with some good ol' fashioned jazz playing.  I've heard they do live bands on the weekends, which I will have to check out.  The service was also not.  Very helpful, not pushy, and certainly knew the food.  Being a newcomer, I try to go off of recommendations, and what the waiter suggested suited me just fine.

I will certainly try them again, and go for some of the other items on the menu.  I had a light lunch, but it was a very satisfactory meal, and one that I would definitely try again in the future.  

A brief, but pleasant experience overall.

I think I died and went to Heaven.  
Place is very cute, informal, clean with great and happy staff.
We ordered Chargrilled oysters, they were just as good as the ones you get in New Orleans.  I ordered bronzed shrimp & Gouda grits with andouille & mushroom ragout.  My DH ordered bronzed shrimp and jambalaya, for dessert we got bananas foster bread pudding.

Next time I'm in Vegas, I hope I can talk my group into going outside of the casino and visiting Lola's.  Or maybe I'll leave them and go myself.  I'm a bit fan of Creole cooking and when I found Lola's, it was a no brainer to check it out.

The staff was very nice and helpful.  

I got a starter and a dinner.  Sorry, no room for dessert.

Crawpuppies:   A little expensive for the small order.  They don't look pretty, in fact they look a little burnt.  Don't let that fool you.  These things were soft and tasty on the inside.  They come with an aioli, but I decided to go with a hot sauce.  You choose.  You can't go wrong.  

Shrimp and Crawfish Etouffee:  It's always a great staple at any Creole restaurant and if you can't make this, you should shut the doors.  The only thing that would have made this better was a ladle so I could have put more in my mouth at once.  It'll be hard to come here and not get this dish again.

Let's start with the food, well it's actually pretty good, it's close to what you will actually find in the Big Easy, it's not up to the standard of some of the good New Orleans restaurants but it's pretty good.

I had the BBQ shrimp, which is 5 shrimp (of a good size) on white rice with a BBQ sauce...For $16...Yeah the price is a little steep for what you get, but it was good. Now it did instantly remind me of the shrimp dish I had at Grind Brgr Bar in Palm Springs, just not as good and 3 times the price.

The wife had the Shrimp and grits....Yeah she is a good southern girl...Wanna be, her Cali heritage though actually liked the dish, again 5 shrimp, grits, for $16...

For dessert we went for the bread pudding, now, this is the star of the place, it's probably the best bread pudding I have eaten, period, so if you are a bread pudding lover then head over there just for that.

Now you are probably wondering why only 3 stars, well, the service.....

Holy crap, we could have easily walked out of the place without paying the bill, despite being seated in front of the waiter station, for whatever reason our waitress decided that we were to be ignored, I actually had to call someone over to ask if she had died....

I should have guessed it was going to be this way when the busser took our drink order, told us """" would be our waitress, then after a while he took our order and delivered the food...then refill drinks, even though by this time he was actually off the clock and in street clothes ready to go home.....And the bill....Yep he dropped of the bill...In fact the only time she actually showed was to collect the bill....

Now sure, wait staff can get busy, but this is a small place, you would really have to be trying for the wait staff to lose you...

But she actually managed to top her no existent service act...She performed an act that is becoming a little bit of a common problem out her...

The bill was $63.48, $100 bill given, change was $36.....Hold on a second, where are the coins...Yeah, for whatever reason she decided to kept the coins...

This has happened a few times at other places. normally a quick "hey you shorted me on my change, but I will just take it out of your tip, grab it from the register" seems like a quick way, but how do you tip someone that hasn't done anything except pick up the bill ???

Well the wife is nicer than me, let's leave it at that...

But overall, good food, horrible service except for the busser (or maybe he was a waiter going off shift, not 100% sure).

Lots of potential but they need to pay more attention to details. We have eaten there three times, so I cannot say I don't like it but so far it has been a mixed bag. It is close to my house and I grew up on this kind of food.

REALLY GOOD: Charbroiled oysters, Fried Oysters, Catfish, French Fries and the BBQ shrimp (twice). Bread Pudding is as good as I have ever had...Damn near perfect!

NOT AS GOOD: Gumbo is tasty but needs to be darker. Fried Crawpuppies tend to come out still cold in the center. BBQ shrimp (third time) had to be sent back. Crabcakes are full of bread but this is NOLA  style not Baltimore. I know they are having problems with the bread getting stale unless it is grilled or toasted.

PRETTY BAD: The Crawfish Etouffee was terrible, very few crawfish and the gravy tasted of nothing but ready-made under cooked roux, YUCK!   The Sweet Potato Pie was pasty and insipid and the crust would make a Cajun Nana cringe.

I will definitely give them another shot and I hope they iron out the problems. But I cannot recommend without caveats.

Good cajun food. The place is small and gets packed for lunch and dinner. The wait is worth it. 

The bar is tiny and  not real functional. However their selection of Abita beer from Louisiana is outstanding. Always try the seasonal. 

The gumbo is and etouffe is good. I had the half shrimp and half crawfish. The crab cake was ok. It was seasoned well but I prefer lump meat crab cakes. The breading here was too much for me.

This was our first time here..I ordered the crab cake and the jumbalaya w/ shrimp.. It was so good!! I really have nothing to compare it to because I have never been to a cajun place other than Razzoo's but I normally just get fried pickles and cat fish.  I have had crab cakes from other places but here the crab cake was super good!! Anywho Because this was our first time here we gave our waitress Dianna a hard time asking her all kinds of questions.. But she hung in there like a champ and really helped us out and was pretty patient with us..  We will def come back here!!

I really liked Lola's.  I wanted to hit up all the Triple D's in the area and Lola's was on the list.  I am not sure how "authentic" the n'awlins fare is (and I've been to NOLA) but the ambiance is nice, the waitstaff is pleasant, and the food is great.

I had the gouda grits and the roast beef po'boy.   When I was in New Orleans in the late 80's, the po'boy seemed to be a gimmick offering that was all about just making a huge, almost un-finish-able sandwich piled so high with meat that you could not even get your jaws around.

At Lola's, the sandwich is more about making an amazing tasting sandwich vs just a huge sandwich.  It is covered in a heavy gravy and stuffed with high quality ingredients.  It was extremely tasty and I finished the whole thing (unlike po buys I had in NO).  The gouda grits were great, nothing like the typical bland grits (sorry, southerners) you get most places.  The cheese really makes this dish pop.

Since I was travelling for work, I was only one person and they sat me in a little 2-seat table by the 'bar', which was perfect for me.

I saw Lola at the door, greeting and saying goodby to customers, which was nice.  I saw one lady with a midwestern accent telling her "I saw you on TV" and she was very nice and accomodating to all of the guests.

I would definitely come back.  In fact, I debated coming back for a 2nd trip during my week+ in Vegas, which is a rule I almost never break (I try to sample a new place every night and not go back to any place I've already tried).  I want to try something with shrimp next time...

Horrible experience. I ordered the catfish platter and to my disbelief it was not cooked all the way. The waiter apologized and took it back to the kitchen. They cooked another one and  a different waiter brought it to the table and said I hope its cooked as you would like it.  Really uncalled for at a time when I could of made a big deal of it. The second fish was cooked this time but no season. It was bland like they floured it and put it in the grease. The manager was brought to the table and I explained what was going on. She just looked at the fish while I was telling her I was not paying for this. She didn't say sorry she just took the plate and brought it back to the kitchen. She took the fish off the bill but charged me for the sides. I'm like really. I paid and left.
I just had my 2nd lunch at Lola's and I love this place.   The food is yummy and obviously fresh and well prepared.   Service is great.  You MUST save room for the bread pudding!

Amazing Gouda grits , the crusted trout was "the business!" From the homemade banana pudding(yes, the pudding is from scratch - like Grandma used to make!) to the awesome banana's foster, my family are foodies and everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meals and each other's  high 5 and thumbs from The Wallace's
Great little place, will definitely be going back.  Wife had the blackened catfish and I had the jambalaya.  Crawpuppy app was great.  Everything was excellent and the service was great.

This place has changed hands and incarnations so many times.  Currently, it's a Louisiana-inspired place.  Tasty food, but pretty pricey for lunch.  I don't think I will be going there again unless someone else is picking up the tab.
Food is great just wish it was bigger and you didnt have to call to make a reservation

Some of the best Cajun food west of New Orleans! Heard about this place on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives and it was absolutely worth finding this place! Make reservations though, cuz they are packed most nights. I had the bronzed shrimp with grits....mmmmm...couldn't get enough! The grits are made with gouda cheese and I wanted more, more, more ~ also make sure to try the fig delight dessert.....soooo yummy! It's like having a warm homemade fig newton....only way better!! I will definitely eat here again and again when I'm back in Vegas~

Been here twice and plan on coming back. The first time I got fried oyster po boy with fries and a lemonade. The second time I got a grilled shrimp po boy. Both times the bread was warm and soft. The grilled shrimp was very tasty it had some seasoning but not too much to over do it. 

Service isn't bad but around lunch time it does get busy. The area is pretty small so it does get packed quick, but there are some tables outside.

May have found a new favorite place!

The service here was outstanding even though it was a Saturday night and they were super busy.
 I made reservations for 630, the earliest they could get me in was 715, I arrived about 7 o'clock at about 705 my table was ready!

For starters we ordered the small bowl of gumbo to share and the crab and artichoke dip, they were both amazing. 

My wife ended up ordering the gumbo dinner and I ordered the shrimp and crawfish ettafee(spelling?) that was just incredible as well, a bit spicy but I loved it!

This was our first experience at Louisiana style food and we just loved it! We will definitely be back to try all of the other items on the menu we are looking forward to going back
After seeing them on Dirty Dinning and there poor response and excuses... NEVER go there again!!!  What where they thinking., to many options to go somewhere else and not get sick

Just so everyone knows...I had high expectations for this place due to all of the reviews. I was so EXCITED to go to this place after I looked at the menu it was RIDICULOUS. From the beginning to end it was bad

1.When we walked in on a Wednesday as soon as they opened there were two people on the patio and two people inside. It was a great day outside and we thought to sit outside first but our waitress WHISKED us inside so quickly we didn't get a second to make up our mind.We sat down to figure out that their air conditioning was on ARCTIC so I told her if we could go outside. SHE LITERALLY ROLLED HER EYES...and said "IT'S A LITTLE WINDY, BUT IF YOU LIKE THAT THEN.." ummm ma'am take us outside please!

2.This was our first time there and my bf was having trouble deciding so we took a little longer to order. Her coming EVERY 5 seconds didn't help. If I were her, I would've maybe suggested an item on the menu or even ask if she could help in any way..NOPE.

3.I ordered the crawfish hush puppies to start and jambalaya with added shrimp. My bf ordered the fried shrimp with the fried oyster, and crab cake. He asked for gritz and greens on the side. The crawfish puppies were interesting.I don't eat crawfish much so I'm not exactly sure how they supposed to taste so I'll just describe what it tasted like.Tart.The jambalaya came and LOOKED very promising.That jambalaya HURT MY FEELINGS. It was the mushiest, no flavor having jambalaya I have EVER TASTED. This jambalaya was the WORST ever. It taste like tomato and mushy rice. The chicken was very small and the shrimp just had no taste to it. My bf's food was COOKED perfectly.His fish was crunchy on the outside, flaky on the inside. He took his first bite and said "It needs A LOT of hot sauce" I tasted that fish and AGAIN no flavor! I mean..NONE I was soooooooo confused because Cajun food usually has SO MUCH FLAVOR..He used half their bottle of hot sauce to give that fish flavor.He taste the grits and actually sent them back because they were so bad. Just so you know my bf isn't the type to send food back. He rather just pour a lot of salt and pepper on it and "make it work" Needless to say, after that HORRIBLE meal and the $70 bill we were done.

On the car ride home, I was sad. I kept saying 'I could've made some Zatarains jambalaya that was better than that"!!


*After I came out of my depression a couple of days later, I went to the OYSTER BAR in the PALACE STATION and ordered the jambalaya and my bf ordered the gumbo. I PROMISE you the HEAVENS SANG! I felt like I was born again. That jambalaya was the ABSOLUTE BEST JAMBALAYA ever. My bf became extremely quiet when we were eating and when I looked up...I SWEAR TO BABY JESUS he was chewing with his eyes closed nodding his head in pleasure! If you want some cajun food..GO THERE!

OMG! Saw the on DDD so I had to check them out when I went to Vegas. Food was amazing, atmosphere was great, servers were friendly. I was glad I arrived when the Crawfish was available. I also had to be a fatty and try the Shrimp & Grits as well. Both incredibly amazing dishes. My wife got the Soft Shell Crab Sandwich and fell in Love. Keep up the good work Lola's!

The shrimp & grits are the most famous thing on the menu but if you eat on the lighter side, get the shrimp ramlouade and crab cake. It's the perfect amount of food. Oh, I also got the gumbo which wasn't light but it was darn good. Great service too!

Food was OK. I hear they are building a new place. I'm happy to hear that because this one is rather small.  I am not a fan of the gumbo. Maybe it was a bad day. The catfish was good. I went one day during lunch. I'd like to go back for dinner and give it another try. The one thing that bothered me is that when I went back to work, I smelled like fried food the re

This popular New Orleans inspired restaurant has been calling me for 3 years. Finally I navigated into the Holsom shopping center for a taste.  Apparently everyone likes this place too as there was no immediate parking.  After 10 minutes of parking lot stalking I found a spot and went inside.  The dining room is small and jam packed with tables. It actually reminded me of some of the places I sampled ages ago when I was in New Orleans.  The menu has po' boy sandwiches, gumbo, creole, remoulade, catfish and more NOLA favorites.  The restaurant has been featured on Diner's Drive ins and Dives and the owner comes from New Orleans.  The wait staff was excellent.  Although they seemed like they were running around like a chicken with its head cut off, they all took time to ask how I was doing.  My waitress suggested the Bronzed Catfish and grits and I took the bait.  

Due to the crowd, the wait for my meal was longer than I would have liked for lunch and I received several apologies from the waitress and the manager.  When the meal came, it was truly worth the wait.  The grits had absorbed the flavor of the well cooked catfish and the gouda/mushroom mixture.  The catfish was well seasoned with a light coating that didn't overpower the fish. 

The bread was an afterthought and did not add anything to the meal but did assist in cleaning the last bites of grits off the plate.

I would have liked it to have more of a cajun kick and will definitely try a spicier option the next trip out.

I only have one New Orleans experience and it was in the early 90's so I am not an expert on New Orleans cuisine by any means but I can say I enjoyed Lolas and will return soon.  For lunch you can expect to pay between $9.00 for the least expensive Po'boy to $16.00 for the catfish and grits.

A bit off the beaten path but oh so worth it. The turn into the lot is a bit tricky too but the Gumbo was ohhh so good! Wish I ordered the meal instead of the bowl. The crawfish hush puppies were good, a bit a heat but just right. And for my entree, I had the Shrimp n Grits. Everything was yummy, worth the trek off the strip. I will defs be back for the Gumbo!

WOW were we happy to be going to see our good friend in Vegas...for 2 months we have been wanting to go to  Lolas. The small restaurant ..maybe 13 tables and a small bar area....2 waitresses and a few kitchen staff....

Ok Drive ins Diners and Dives..get real...this place is so bad....Guy you should be careful of the recommends you dish out.

Good thing we were not starving because we went home wanting for soooo much more from this lunch experience had to offer....

cesar salad......boring basic and tiny..
blackened catfish with side of slaw and greens.....thee cat fish was not blackened it tasted no better than Zatarans cajun seasoning mix...no cruch or blackening what so ever....boring and small ...the greens   so basic   none of the flavors of bacon as stated in the menu ..just salt lingering from the cat fish....the slaw was drippy with mayo and basic....boring.
The oyster poorboy...tasted ok...small...but better than anything else on the table...but 
NOW HERES THE REAL BIG PROBLEM   ... the stupid fries took a bad meal to a BAD EXPERIENCE...simple problem...the fries with the poorboy were cold..the waitress said she would bring another side...and to continue eating and she would bring a fresh HOT order...30 minutes later no fries..the waitress says 'she messed up and she would bring them right away...10 minutes later no fires....ok no worries   we were so far from in love with this joke of a restaurant that we said remove them from the bill and we are outta here...NOT SO EASY......THE WAITRESS SAID SHE PAI D FOR THE FRIES HER SELF..LIKE WHAT DOES THAT MEAN ..ALL BUT 60  CENTS WERE STILL ON THE BILL...WTF?   ok at this point there was no reasoning to be had....we are angry the waitress is daft and the woman who said she could function as the manager was of no help....10 minutes of having a 'situation' they deducted 4$ from the ticket we were free to get the hell outta that crappy place,,

bad food   bad service and apparantly a lousy non concerned cook staff....who the hell is managing this place????

NEVER AGAIN.......THIS DAFT STAFF SHOULD ALL BE FIRED!!!

DID I SAY HOW MUCH I DSLIKE THIS PLACE?

Best creole food i've had outside of Louisiana itself. The Only thing I did not like was the Gouda cheese in the grits. I feel they should use a less stronger cheese, like parmesan or pepper jack, any thing light. the gouda cheese was very strong in the grits. besides that HOT DAMN! it was delicious .

A hidden gem just off I-15 at Charleston. This was my first visit. My wife and I will be going back again and again. If you like southern food, this IS the place for you. Try it. You won't be disappointed -- 10 stars for the food and 11 for the service. Can't wait to go back.

Shrimp N Grits as good as the first time.
Abita Amber is a nice beer.
Sweet Potato Pie with Pecans was tasty.

It's ridiculous and fabulous and everything you want an authentic New Orleans restaurant to be.  

  The food is fantastic. All of it.

  If you are OK with fabulous food, cramped quarters and a potential wait- go..

 Oh and hey, Geaux Saints!

Lola's is a diner with great creole food. If you want to eat at 12pm, make reservations. The crab cake dinner was very good and the mixed greens underneath was a pleasant surprise. The catfish and grits was also wonderful with the ragout adding to the flavor of the grits.

Came in here today on a whim with my mom. The first impression of this place was that it was pretty unassuming. Decorated in a Mardi Gras style with the purple gold and green colors.  Luckily we got there before the crowd did so we're we're seated immediately. 
We decided to share the D'Brees po'boy aka the roast beef one, gumbo and, the Gouda grits. It came out pretty fast we couldn't help but notice how fast the restaurant filled up. The servers were running around like crazy trying to keep up and doing a great job. 
The po'boy was fantastic. The meat was perfectly tender and the gravy with it was awesome. The lightly toasted bread had great texture and flavor. The gumbo cup was super tasty.  It was rich and flavorful loaded with sausage, chicken and, okra. The rice on the bottom added a nice balance to the dish.  The grits reminded me of a risotto. They were perfectly done. Not too runny or too set. The flavor was well balance and the addition of the cheese was a masterful touch. 
Lola's does Cajun and creole food right. It is simple and yet extremely flavorful. We will definitely come back to try more things.

Incredibly delicious food full of lively cajun flavors and spices.  Wait staff was friendly and informative.   My only complaint was I was still very hungry after finishing my meal.  I highly recommend the bronze shrimp and grits but the real treat ( that everyone should experience) is the bananas foster bread pudding!

My wife and I came here after attending the Olympia Expo, and we were extremely impressed. The location is tucked away and easy to miss, but the atmosphere is very welcoming once you walk in. The service was great. The hostess Lisa was very welcoming and displayed the Southern hospitality you only experience in the South. My main craving was mud bugs, but since they were out of season, I settled on the shrimp and Gouda grits which were the best tasting shrimp and grits I've had outside of Charleston SC. My wife and I devoured our food and enjoyed some LA beers they had on tap before rolling out of the place fat and happy. We will definitely be coming back.

Clean restaurant and very nice staff. I tried the catfish/sausage plate and it was good. Not melt in your mouth goodness, but I'd definitely try it again. I also tried the pecan pumpkin slice with the chantilly cream on top, but the cream tasted IMMENSELY AWFUL!!! It tasted spoiled and left such a bad taste in my mouth that I felt like I needed to hurl. YUCK!!

***Ok, but NOT authentic!***  LSU grad, Lafayette native here. Lola's is the kind of place that I suspect was founded by a South Louisiana native who then passed off the kitchen to someone who didn't grow up eating mawmaw's cooking in Crowley and doesn't really know what it's supposed to taste like. They try hard, but the flavors are just off. Gumbo has the same bland gravy flavor that most places have. They have a great atmosphere and lots of varieties of Abita, but the food is overpriced and doesn't have any soul to it. Recommendation: Get some nonviolent felon old man out of Angola to cook for ya, Lola.

Very disappointed with what used to be one of my favorite restaurants.  First their fan was not working so the place was full of smoke, I ordered the same thing I order every time and the waitress brought the wrong dish and said "this is what I wrote down if you want something else you will have to pay", are you kidding.  Well I was not in the mood to argue so I ate the meal I did not order.  The grits were terrible, clumpy and had three pieces of sausage which I counted because I was already pissed off, and the portion was much smaller than it used to be. My friend enjoyed her meal ( the same thing she gets every time) which is why I gave two stars ... but Lola's... you lost a repeat customer there are other cajan places to try.

This little hidden gem really offers some tasty food. It is right off of Charleston and the interstate 15. Super close to work too which works great for lunch. I have eaten here twice now and been satisfied both times. It is not a very big place, but quaint and good service. I love the Guy Fieri signature on the top of the ceiling. All kinds of southern dishes to choose from. I am not that acquainted with southern food but I do enjoy some red beans/rice/andouille sausage!

This time I was a bit hungry and selected the platter that came with chicken, salmon or shrimp and your choice of two sides. I selected the grilled shrimp, coleslaw and fries. My friend enjoyed the same platter with salmon. Our server was Andy and he was really friendly and helpful. When the entrees arrived, there was chicken on my plate and not a shrimp in sight. Andy admitted he had made a mistake and promptly informed me he would change it. I told him it was ok, I would eat the chicken. He bent over backwards and still served me the grilled to perfection shrimp and did not charge me. Wow! So kind of him. The coleslaw was also very tasty but the fries unfortunately tasted old and tired. I only had a couple and then stopped eating them. The four stars is all about Andy and the great customer service he provided. Thanks again Andy! The southern hospitality you provided was definitely worth another visit!

When ever I'm in Las Vegas I have to stop at this little small restaurant Lolas it's a little hard to find well u can drive rite pass it but once u been there u never forget close to the strip and outlet mall. But it has the best Grits n Mushroom with ragu sauce I can just scream the cheese  and creamy grits just melt in my mouth the mushrooms have a meaty taste like sausage I strongly suggest you try them along with some chicken breast and bread pudding delicious oh n don't forget the red beans n  rice with French bread

Purchased the catfish platter and online it has 3 catfish filets listed, but I received 2. When I called asking for my 3rd piece I was told the online menu is wrong and wasn't accommodated or compensated for their error. Also we ordered at 12 noon when they opened and received soggy fries. Overall the food was good, but they have poor customer service.

I needed some legit food after eating cafeteria food all day at the convention center. Thankfully, my homegirl (who is a local brought me here). We were able to make reservations  an hour before arriving and got sat right away. The restaurant is pretty small so I definitely recommend that if you're going with a big party. 

If you're coming here, I must insist that you get their baked oysters. I dont know what kind of sauce, cheese, or voodoo maguc they have on there, but it is crack! We split a dozen pieces between us two tiny girls, but I could've easily packed down a dozen myself. It paired really well with the bread. I was trying to dip my excess sauce from the oysters on it too.

Don't get discouraged when you see their flaming fire sign on their menu. If you're a big spicy eater, I'd compare this to a mild you'd find at boiling crab or soon du bu. For entrees, it looks like everyone goes for either the shrimp & grits or the catfish & grits. My friend got the catfish option. Their catfish was delicious. It wasn't deep fried, but still had a nice crisp texture on the outside. I was craving some pasta and got the shrimp charlotte. Its a light mushroom based sauce with shrimp on top of angel hair. I really enjoyed this dish (mainly because im such a huge mushrooms and angel hair fan). I definitely recommend this dish to pasta lovers, but if you want something more hearty, I would push you to try one of the grits. Overall, great call on my friend's part. Definitely see myself coming back to try more!

Yes Yes Yes!!! Finally a place I can say I had some authentic Cajun food in this town. My family is from Louisiana and so I still frequent the Big Easy a lot. I've been looking for some real Cajun food in Las Vegas for a while. I've tried some imitators in the Spring Mountain area but they have their own Asian take on Cajun. Lola's however is the real deal. My party and I split some red beans and rice, jambalaya and crawfish etouffee and I have to say it was superb!!.. Granted I'm sure I've had some better dishes in the French Quarter, but I think thats mainly a subjective opinion. I felt like I was back at home here. It's a small casual place with some hints of the "Who Dat" Saints, Mardi Gras beads and they were also playing zydeco music. I was going to take pictures and remembered only after I had cleaned every plate clean. Needless to say, I am VERY happy to finally have found my Cajun spot in Vegas.  Prices were fair as well! If you like Cajun, get your derriere down to Lolas and laissez les bon temps rouler!

Haven't been here in several years, so I thought I'd give it a go.  I stopped eating here after being disappointed after several tries. I really really really want to like this place - but it just doesn't work for me. The food just does not compare to the good stuff in Louisiana, sorry. Maybe if you've never been to NOLA this suffices.

Wait staff was nice, but slow. Sat for five or ten minutes before asked for a drink choice. Chargrilled oysters overcooked with no oyster flavor, the seasonings overpower. Friend was disappointed in flavorless jambalaya. I will say the shrimp/crawfish etouffee was decent.

Sorry, Lola's, won't be coming back.

My husband and I are lovers of New Orleans food so when we saw that we could get chargrilled oysters in Vegas, we were really excited.  

The restaurant is small, strangely laid out and the service was sub-par. My husband got a Caesar salad and oysters. His salad was great and it came out quickly. Then- we waited and waited and waited. Finally his oysters came out. They weren't that impressive and left him feeling hungry. My cheese poboy and grits finally came out after he was done eating. Much to my disappointment, I got a grilled cheese (not a poboy- dressed as requested) and some cold, soggy fries. The grits were okay. 

They comped my meal, so that was appreciated.
Not completely authentic, but the most authentic Cajun/creole restaurant I have eaten at in Las Vegas.
Food was great...made a reservation to ensure our seat. Wasn't too crowded the day we went. Host didn't even need to check for reservation.

I am not a southern girl but I know good food. And Lola's is the best southern cooking in Las Vegas. It is small and the service is very good. We always make sure we have reservations when we want to go there. I had the bronzed Catfish and Gouda grits, with a side of greens it was exceptional.  My husband my friend had bronzed shrimp and Gouda grits and my friend s boyfriend had the étouffée.    Every one thought the choice was the best and a good time was had by all.

Went here for my birthday. The service was great, the waitress was very friendly and attentive. Our whole party was raving about their food, and were very full and satisfied by the end of their meals. I ordered the deep fried soft-shelled crab, and my wife ordered the gumbo. Both of the dishes were delicious. We can't wait to go back!
Better than every Cajun style restaurant I've eaten in, in New Orleans! Shrimp & Smoked Gouda Grits with Mushroom Ragu is my favorite!

I think I probably just had a really bad experience here as a first timer. I ordered gumbo which was OK (I still prefer the oyster bar at palace or Texas station) and a combo platter that consists of fried catfish, fried shrimps, fried oysters, and crab cake for $25. I only ate the 2 shrimps and one fried oyster. The crab cake was fishy and the catfish tasted like dirt off the ground and I'm not really into that. I figured I could ask for some lemon and squeeze onto my crab cake to kill some of the fishy taste and next thing you know...the guy took out a container of lemon and DUG UNWASHED BARE HIS HAND INTO IT to get me my lemons. Can somebody say "HEALTH CODE VIOLATION?!"...boy like I'm going to be using those lemons now...meaning, I just paid and left with a full plate of food on the table. 

SERVICE: I'd give this place a 2 star for service. They were not very attentive to our party and they forgot our side twice. 

Maybe it was an off day for them, but the food and the service wasn't appealing enough for me to even remotely want to go back there again.

I had been dying to try Lola's and my friend's birthday was the perfect opportunity! Since there were 4 of us, we decided to go all-out and try a ton of menu items. We made a reservation for Saturday night and were greeted by Lola, herself, at the door. The place is tiny, cozy, and adorable; a true hole in the wall. Here is the low-down on the meal:

Crab cake - I am VERY picky about my crab cakes and these were delicious! Lots of crab and not a lot of filler. A beautiful sear on both sides and the lemon aioli was fantastic. The crab cakes were second only to my own.

Craw-puppies - hush-puppies with Crawfish mixed in the batter, very inventive! These were crispy and delicious, but maybe a touch too soft/undercooked in the middle.

Gumbo - The gumbo looked good and started off great on my palate, but lacked seasoning, mainly salt, and spice.

Catfish and grits - OMG the cheesy grits were unbelievable, I literally did not want to eat the last bite. The catfish was cooked perfectly, but not exactly what I expected. They even gave me some crispy bread to soak everything up. 

My dining companions had Po-boys and raved about the bread. I was able to steal some french fries and was so glad I did, they were fantastic. My husband had the trout, it wasn't bad but it was a little on the fishy side for me. 

Sweet Potato Pecan Pie - I wish there was more sweet potato and less pecan, but paired with the chantilly cream it was delicious and I found myself constantly going back for just one more bite.

Lola's Famous Bread Pudding - I am not a fan of bread pudding, but my friends forced me to take a bite and it really wasn't bad.

Banana's Foster - The highlight of dessert, we were literally watching each spoonful and silently hating each other for having good taste! It was the best banana's foster I have ever had. A delicious sweet brown sugar coating with the warm bananas and cold vanilla ice cream...yes please!

Overall, Lola's is a great Cajun alternative to the real deal. There were definitely some high points to the meal, but there were a few mediocre points as well. I wish they had live jazz, that would really create some true NOLA ambiance. I will definitely be back to check out more of the menu and I am so glad we have a great Cajun restaurant in Las Vegas!

Awesome food, great atmosphere!  The Gouda grits are unbelievable.... As are the grilled oysters, the po-boys and all the desserts.  Bread puddings are all great and the fig delight the best fig newton you can ever have.   Lola's is a "must" every time I come home to Vegas.

This place was absolutely bomb.

They do all the cajun classics and they do them very, very well.

This location is absolutely TINY. Make a reservation before you head here (especially if it's not a day where you could stand to sit outside).

What a fantastic little place! 

Worth the trip off the strip. Best gumbo I've ever had outside New Orleans. I wish I had pictures to show you but, my family and I devoured everything faster than I could take pictures.

Ask for Lisa! She's a doll and a wonderful guide for your experience!

It's small but the food is so worth it.  We ordered the crawpuppies, crab artichoke dip, Gouda grits, Jambalaya, a crab cake, and the roast beef po' boy and we shared and sampled everything. It was all ridiculously delicious and extremely reasonably priced.  I cannot express how good the food was and the service was outstanding.

Wanted to check this place out because it was on DDD and I was in Vegas.

Sweet tea was good & free refills!

Loved the crab cake and crab artichoke dip for starters 

Bronzed catfish and grits were good! BF had the Shrimp Charlotte.

Banana Foster was good too loved he ice cream!

Took the crab Po'Boy to go!

Will be visiting again whenever I come back to Vegas!

Lolas has to be one of my FAVORITE restaurants in Las Vegas. They have GREAT customer service and the food is D-Lish. I highly recommend the Crab Artichoke Dip-Ummm you can taste the freshness in every bite. Lot's of crab inside..you'll want more TRUST me. Another great dish is
The best tasting cajun food I've ever tasted! It was so easy to find and they have just obtained a loyal customer for life.

Im down with this place.
I like sitting outside. And I like their crab sandwiches... Poor crabs, they don't have a chance. 

I have tried the crab po-boy, and the shrimp and grits. Both fantastic.
Have only been twice , but from what I experienced they deserve a good rating. 

My mom lost her credit card there once and the staff totally found it and returned it very next day. Great people, nice city view, in the boarders of the art's district.

First time trying this place out. Nice staff, we were greeted at the door and sat immediately. Our waitress Lisa was nice and recommended their top dishes. We went with the Shrimp and Grits and the roast beef po boy. Both were really good and had some great flavor. My husband and I also shared a bowl of their gumbo for an appetizer, that as well did not disappoint. I've never had grits I actually like. I'll definitely return.

This was my 2nd visit and although 1st time was a disappointment I'm definitely a fan. I first stopped by last year right after a trip to New Orleans, was super excited to see barbecue shrimp on the menu. It ended up being a big let down - think it was $17 or $18 for 4 shrimp in a not spicy sauce and a huge mound of rice. I left feeling a little ripped off- it felt like that should've been a $12 appetizer vs an entree.  
I went with friends for lunch last week and LOVE Lola's now. We were seated outside and I think the server forgot about us for a while. But the food made up for it. I had the soft shell crab po boy - huge, bread was cut in half with 1 crab in each so perfect for sharing. Crispy yummy crab on their light flaky bread. I got the potato salad, which was just ok. Fries were also mediocre, but sweet potato fries were possibly the best I've ever had. Had some of my friends fried shrimp po boy too - only 4 shrimp total, which is a little skimpy but the shrimp were pretty fat and super sweet. 
Also tried a bite of someones blackened catfish. I've never been a fan of catfish but this was so spicy and flavorful I'd totally order it next time.
Rhythm kitchen is still my fav Creole place in town but I'm loving Lola's for their po boys. Oh and the buttered grilled bread they bring you is also a must

What a great find Lola's was while we stayed in Vegas. We love creole food! The Gouda grits were like a dream, & I'm not even a fan of them. I could eat those all day long even though cheese is not my friend. I enjoyed my jambalaya & my husband really loved his shrimp po-boy. They don't have a kids menu so the kids shared a burger (so good) and we also tried the craw puppies, although we would never get them again as they are not worth the price. They were delicious though.

Service was top notch and quick on a Thursday despite not having reservations. It's just a short drive from the busy part of the strip. Their happy hour had some good beers too.

We made an unneeded reservation via Yelp and came a little early. Plenty of seating. What drove me to come was the chargrilled oysters which were definitely disappointing. They were Unshucked and were the size of quarters. Hardly worthy of a $24 a dozen prize tag. 

Decor was awesome. Love the LSU and saints gear!

I've had Lola's on my to-do list for many years and finally took the plunge. 

I came in on a Saturday right before the dinner rush and was able to be seated at the bar without a wait. The hostess was very pleasant to me and made me feel welcome even without a reservation. The restaurant filled up quickly afterwards so I was especially thankful. 

I started off with a cup of gumbo. I don't usually do appetizers but it was my first time eating Cajun cuisine in many years so I had to try theirs. I was torn between shrimp and beef for my sandwich so having some shrimp in the gumbo made it possible to satisfy both cravings. Satisfying is an understatement for this dish. Well done, 5/5 for sure. 

Ordered the roast beef debris po boy with all the dressings. I really liked the flavor combination. The crispness of the bread was perfect contrast for the soggy gravy. The meat portion left much to be desired unfortunately. Although I enjoyed the flavor profile I am disappointed that I left hungry. I wish I would have taken a picture so I could compare it to future visits. This was during dinner so I assumed it would be a good representation of their flagship product. Unfortunately, it was not. I will give it a second chance just in case it was an off day or a stingy cook. 2/5

I'll be back.

Place was whatever. Would I recommend to anyone? Meh probably not. Would I come here again? Mehhhh. Probably not. Got the crab cakes, had better. Got the wings and fries got 5 wings, just 5. They were okay. Looks like we bought fries with a side of wings. Crawpuppies, don't do it. Gumbo sad it was a 16 oz order probably a 6 oz. better off getting the cup you'll get more for your money. Shrimp and grits were good. And then the soft shell crab Po'boy. It was decent as well. All in all a mediocre dining experience. When we were sat we had to ask for our order to be taken by not our waiter/waitress. No even hello be right with you after we were sat. Food looks good though when you get it. $75 for two because we wanted to try and get a taste of a few things in. Probably not worth it.

Solid four stars. The Jambalaya was awesome, and one of the best parts was the chef makes his own hot sauce, and it was fantastic. My wife got a crab Po'Boy and loved it as well. We are looking forward to going back.

This is the place to chow down if you're in the mood for New Orleans food! The jambalaya was spicy and loved the andouille sausage and it complimented the shrimp and chicken. I also indulged in a platter of another NO staple, red beans & rice and of course, added the andouille sausage and it was good but not as tasty as the jambalaya. I started out with a cup of gumbo. I am definitely hooked on this place and had the pleasure of meeting Lola and the service was very good. Will definitely return on my next trip to Sin City and will check out the Catfish!

I found this place after doing a Yelp search while shopping at the outlets in Vegas, and it was definitely a great find!  It's very unassuming from the outside, but the inside is bustling with customers.  The New Orleans decorations are fun without being over-the-top or tacky.  I ordered the shrimp po-boy.  The shrimp were perfectly cooked and pretty big in size.  I would definitely come here again the next time I'm in Vegas.

This place is absolutely amazing!

Went in last night with about 10 people for my boyfriend's birthday. We all order a bunch of different things so we got to taste a little bit of everything. Everything was delicious.

My boyfriend ordered the oyster app, which was probably the most delicious oysters I have ever had. This says a lot because I'm from California so we used to go to the pier and have fresh seafood all the time.

I ordered the hot crab artichoke dip, also really good. The only down fall is not having enough break for it. The bread they give is omfg amazing. I think I ate a few pieces of the bread by itself (probably why I ran out for the dip).

For entree boyfriend ordered New Orlean's BBQ shrimp, I got the shrimp creole. My dish was so flavorful and so fresh and amazing, my only complaint was not having enough shrimp on there but it's not even a big deal because you can literally just eat the rice with the sauce and it's fantastic.

We got the Bananas Foster Bread Pudding and the Bananas Foster. Both are absolutely delicious. The Bananas Foster comes with vanilla ice cream which is much needed because those bananas are effing hot. The bread pudding was also amazing.

We ordered some beers and sweet tea which were also really good. 

For having such a big table of people, the restaurant was able to accommodate us inside comfortably. The service was great, could have been a bit nicer but it's not something you really care about because you're distracted with all of your friends to care. They get really really busy and for good reason. We were with someone who grew up in Louisiana and he also enjoyed all of the food.

We will definitely be back to explore the menu.

We have been to Lola's twice in the last week. I celebrated my birthday on the second visit. It was so good I had to come back. If you go you must try the shrimp and grits. Our favorite desert was the bananas foster bread pudding combo. So yummy.

My fiancé and I came in before our show at the Smith Center last night but the food didn't live up to the hype. We started with a crab cake which was delicious but not thoroughly heated. It had salty chunks of crab and a tangy mayo on top that we enjoyed (even more so had it been warmer). I ordered jambalaya and my fiancé ordered the gumbo and I found myself wishing I had ordered the gumbo. The spice level in his dish was perfect and they brought garlic bread to sop up the excellent flavor. My jambalaya was fairly bland which I wasn't expecting at all! The dish was maybe 20 percent chicken and sausage and 80 percent rice. I added hot sauce just to give it some sort of kick and wished someone had talked me into ordering it with shrimp. We finished with Lola's famous bread pudding which was too rich for me but my fiancé loved it. Very dense but too much with the sauce, raisins and candied nuts, in my opinion. We also tried the banana pudding and that was probably my least favorite banana pudding I've ever had. Maybe because it was 7pm on a Friday and it was not the freshest? It was bland with a burnt marshmallow topping and very soggy nilla wafers. I did have some community coffee which was smooth and not bitter at all. I had two cups and a to go cup full as well. We might come back for more gumbo and maybe we'll try the crawpuppies and bananas foster instead.

Where do I begin-Last evening 10/3/13 a group of us had dinner at Lola's on Charleston Blvd here in Las Vegas.  My thanks go out to Lola, Hank and our server Lisa for giving me and us a wonderful dining experience.  This group I belong to randomly pick restaurants here in the valley that have good pricing, great environment and not chain restaurants each month.

When I walked in the door ONE HOUR EARLY, Hank welcomed me, I sat at the bar and had a cup of their delicious GUMBO.  Once my other dinner friends came, LISA explained in detail the favorites of the house.  The camaraderie of friends, great food and excellent service
will remain  in my mind as one of the best dining experiences Ive had here in LV since arriving 3 years ago from the BAY AREA.  at the end of the meal we took a group picture with LOLA.  

Once more I want to thank Hank, Lisa and Lola for such a wonderful dining experience.

My favorite place to visit in LV.  The bronzed shrimp and grits is superb as are the craw puppies.  My waistline doesn't need it, but the banana foster bread pudding is sinfully too amazing to pass up.  Skip the strip and head to Lola's.
Fantastic fresh catfish, great service!  Make sure you make a reservation!

Hearing about this place from many people that I work with, so I thought we would give it a go a little while ago. My husband and I love creole food! Suggestions were made to us to try the catfish and grits. Was delicious! I don't even like catfish!!! 

I personally ordered the gumbo and couldn't stop eating it! 

We have yet to try the banana bread pudding. Again, heard it was worth it. However just my luck they did not have it the night we went. :( 

The only things is the size of the restaurant being so tiny, it felt very cramped. Since it is so busy all the time, I almost felt a tiny bit rushed watching people in line waiting for tables.  That is probably just me though...my guilty conscious. 

Can't wait to go back and try more!! Wish their patio would take reservations though.

Came here after doing a google search of Diners, Drive Ins, and Dives for Las Vegas...  I've been craving cajun food, specifically jambalaya, so opted to try here.

A Small divey restaurant with the interior adorned with lots of New Orleans memorabilia--paintings, ornaments, New Orleans Saints items, etc...  Along with the dim lighting, put me back in time to a setting in Louisiana...

Service was fantastic.  The outgoing server helped me think aloud with my decision on what to order.  The pic of the crabcake looked interesting, but I didn't think I could finish it along with my entree.  I discussed their Po Boy which was featured on Triple D, but I had been craving good jambalaya for a long time.  Sooo ultimately, I went with jambalaya.

Big mistake.

The rice in the jambalaya was extremely mushy.  Killed the whole dish.  Obviously not freshly cooked and sitting in a huge pot of sauce for hours.  And where was the chicken and sausage?  Sparsely added... Why not 3 stars instead of 2?  Mushy riced jambalaya should never be served if you are charging people money to eat it...  Just my 2 cents...

The dining experience has gone downhill. I ordered Cajun chicken which was nothing more than a cooked chicken breast with Cajun seasonings you could have grabbed from your own cupboard ~Very bland. Husband ordered the Jambalaya with like maybe 5 shrimp which was served in a dish small enough to be a side dish. Some of the chairs have black masking tape on them. If you're hungry you might think twice about coming to this overpriced place.

Get'em  in and Get'm out!

Another stop for my DDD list.  I am not sure why I keep falling for this.  Of course the food was,"Killer!", like everything Guy seems to eat. 
Well the crab cake, what we started with, was not "Killer."  It was mushy, under seasoned, and tasted and had a texture more like paste in the inside than lump crab. 

I had the shrimp and grits and my friend had the blackened salmon, both totally edible, in fact they weren't bad.  I wish that the sauce on my grits was a little more viscous.  It began to get watery at the end.  My friend enjoyed the Salmon, but apparently it was slightly over seasoned in areas.  

My partners main complaint was that the portion size did not match the price.  For the price maybe the salad should come with the meal.  Also they're grits for crying out loud!  It's cheap hominy corn.  Put some more of them on the plate with the four shrimp.  It was an entree right?  "How long does it take you to cook your grit?"  Joe Pesci fans, Unite!

They had a special memorial day dessert, it was for the troops of course, so we tried it.  It was advertised to us as a cobbler, but it ended up being more of a shortcake type of dessert.  Never-the-less it was delicious and we gobbled it up.

The final downer was the being rushed, but we're not rushing you atmosphere.  I hadn't even got my full ass in the seat before the waitress was asking us what we wanted to drink.  How about bring us some water and a menu.  I almost stabbed a bus boy with my fork when he attempted to grab my plate before my last bite was gone.  Actually it was the last bite of my friends salmon, but jeeshhhhh, ASK!  I may have wanted to lick the plate, not really, but I like to keep my options open!
Plate Lickers Unite!

Small, intimate place, decorated very cute , and staff was friendly. I will be coming back, because this place had some if the BEST blue crab cakes I've ever had. The texture was just right. They come over leafy greens, which was good but I didn't eat all the spinach..it was just a bit too much. Other then that that crab was amazing.  My friend got the Fettuccini Alfredo topped w grilled salmon, I tried this and that was also very, very good. Taste was just right. The sweet tea was bomb, especially in this heat.  I had like 5 glasses. If you're a Vegas local I would def recommend this place if you're looking for a different ambiance, and some good food.

I just have to say right away OMG!
OMG! OMG!

Ok now in full disclosure I love Cajun and Louisiana style food. As far as the food goes it is some of the best Cajun Ive had in a long time

We had the combo platter and it was mostly fried but lightly battered. The crab cake had great flavor and wasn't full of filler. The shrimp was great and you could tell they were fresh and never frozen. The collard greens werent great but acceptable. My GF said they weren't real collard greens and she wished she could find at least one place that served them right. (Any ideas let me know please)

I had the Blackened shrimp pasta. It was wonderful. I wish I had asked before ordering as I would have loved a piece of their catfish blackened like that and they do serve it like that so if you want blackened catfish I would give it a try.

The crawfish balls were good but had a little tangy flavor I couldnt place. I would try them again.

The decor is typical New Orleans style and it is small and almost cramped inside. I guess they call it intimate but I dont like having to listen to the conversations of those around you. 

The staff is very knowledgeable I ended up talking to our server after our meal and their lunch rush had left. She said you lucked out by being seated so quick. You should always call and make a reservation as they dont have ample seating.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

My fiancé came here 2 weeks ago while he was in Vegas and he can't stop talking about the fried shrimp po'boy, the blackened shrimp po'boy and the bananas foster. We'll be in Vegas next weekend, so I can't wait to try the food for myself. My family is from New Orleans, so I'm keeping my fingers crossed that Lola's hits the spot. I'll be back to update my review.

This is one of those places where you need to know where it is. You can ride right past this place and not know what is there. It is a very small spot pretty much in the middle of nowhere. I felt like I wanted everything on the menu. For the place to be small it wasn't really a wait and the food comes fast. I can also say that the server was good. She was very attentive and kept checking on us. I ordered the Gumbo, Catfish, and shrimp and grits. The food was pretty good. The one thing that bothered me was the weird pricing. If you order the catfish dinner and want an extra piece of fish, the price doubles. That makes no damn sense at all. The shrimp and grits serving was small and overpriced. 

Overall I am not disapointed with the spot.
Awesome!!!!! Great place off the strip. A little hole in the wall, with a lot to offer...

Amazing! Amazing! Amazing!!!! 
The food is always out of this world! 
We arrived late and there was a big table of people being served so our service was kind of slow but she apologized about it and we just knew the food would make up for it and got were we right! We ordered the Char broiled oysters, blackened catfish, crab cakes with Red beans and rice and of course we were in heaven! 
Thank you for never giving us anything to complain about except being full! 
Can't wait to go back!
Still a favorite. The customer service was excellent. All servers were attentive and assisted us when  we needed anything.  I definitely would recommend this place. Oh and the food is AMAZING!!!

This place was worth this review. I had shrimp and gouda grits which was amazing. Whatever the sauce is was great. I also had the crab cake which was delicious as well. Our waiter was from new orleans and was very helpful and kind. Desert was amazing as well the banana foster was to die for. The banana pudding is great and you can't go wrong with a  brownie and ice cream

Oh, my, what a wonderful dinner Thursday night here at Lola's!  We decided to go to Lola's at the downtown location because of its proximity to The Smith Center and the good Yelp reviews.  Everything was so good, I didn't even pause to take a picture!  My dining companion ordered chicken strips and fries with a side cup of red beans and rice.  He graciously allowed me a taste of each and everything was excellent!  I ordered the pecan crusted trout with Gouda grits and a side salad - absolutely superb!  The Gouda grits were a perfect accompaniment to the trout.  The pecans fell off the trout into the grits while eating it and added a lovely nice crunch. The Gouda grits come with several dishes and are a must try. In addition, Lola's absolutely knows how to cook fish properly. The side salad was ample and the house dressing spicy and fresh.  Lola's definitely is on my "must return" list to try other items on their menu.  But I will have to look away from the pecan crusted trout!
Food was amazing...I had the Oyster Poboy with fries...if you go have the bread pudding...the staff were great. Ruth was our server she was engaging and well versed in the menu..
Ordered a bronzed catfish poboy. Sandwich was good and the bread was soft, flaky, and fresh.  Just wished there was more than 1 catfish fillet in it.

Fantastic spot! For an appetizer we ordered the crab cake which came with lemony lettuce under it... That was amazing. For dinner I ordered the Blackened Shrimp & Grits... Wth... That was amazing! Then for dessert we had the bananas foster bread pudding... Omg that was amazing too! Super happy with this place. The service and food was superb! I'll be coming back for sure!

On our first night in Vegas, after a long heavily trafficked drive, we decided to stay in and order take out. 

You have to know what to order here because it can be delicious, but it can also be blah. 

Bear ordered the shrimp over grits and it was mind blowing. MIND BLOWING!!! 

I ordered the jambalaya and it was yuck! YUHUCK!!! 


So think carefully before you order, ask them what their specialties are, what's popular on their menu, etc. 

An other thing I was extremely unhappy with, and I don't know if it's the same in the restaurant but, their take out portions are tiny. The pictures I'm about to share shows the food as it came before we started eating. Considering the amount of food, this place is heavily over priced!! 

I would go back for the shrimp and grits, but I would eat it there so I could demand more food lol
This place is The Bomb!!! A Must for every visit to Vegas. I have recommended it to everyone I knew would be in Las Vegas & they have all agreed with my review. Try it, you'll like it!!

Never having a po boy wasn't quite sure what to expect, of the sandwich or the restaurant. 

Was pleasantly surprised when walked into the restaurant. Looked very nice and well appointed with a theme from down south. The waitresses here I found to be top notch and very attentive. 

Had the po boy, or however it's spelled, that was featured on DDD and it has a very good flavor and the meat was tender. Maybe it was me but expected little more flavor.  Was GREAT for what I got, and the service.

It is a little on the pricey side so make sure to bring a little extra.

I've had Lola's on my radar for a while, but I've never been a huge fan of Cajun food. I decided to give in and come here for a post Christmas celebration with my OG.

We walked in and we were seated quickly. Everything looked pretty good but I decided on the bronzed shrimp and grits and my friend ordered the jambalaya with added shrimp.

My dish was great. The grits were nice and cheesy and the shrimp had a great kick. Very spicy. My friend enjoyed his dish quite a bit and said his was incredibly spicy too, in a positive way.

Service was attentive and friendly. Luckily they were very good about keeping the refills coming, it was definitely appreciated with the spice levels they serve.

I have tried the Jambalaya in almost every place in the city that I can order it...and this place is by far the best. Just the right amount of heat for my taste. The added strip was amazing just on it's own. Service is very good. It's a small dining area, so if you have a large party or are impatient, make a reservation.

So nice to get off the strip and try something different while visiting Las Vegas!  Stopped by for a late, light lunch on a Thursday.  The service was friendly and attentive.  Sitting outside was nice.  The gumbo was dandy as was the crab cake. Hubby loved the fries but I like them crispy-er so I had to hunt for the little crunchy ones.  Great flavor, though.  Bill for the foregoing with a VooDoo ale and 2 glasses of house chardonnay came to $35.  Don't know if I'd make a special trip to come here but it's certainly worth it if you are in the area.

It's my first trip to Lola's and surely won't be my last.  If the shrimp po' boy is any indication of the rest of the menu, this place will be soon a fave of mine.  The shrimp were about the size of prawns lightly battered set on a bed of shredded lettuce tomato and tartar sauce. Simple but it just tasted really good and fresh.  This will be a spot to watch some football thus season. I might convert to being a Saints fan, who dat!  Nah, hell no Go Niners!!! WE DAT!!!

Just about one of the best meals in Las Vegas! Great service & food. Never had a bad experience. Nice to visit after the drive from Arizona! Can't wait to return for another awesome meal! KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK! Had 2 shrimp dinners that were perfect.

Incredible food!  Their Etoufee was so good, and their roast beef sandwich (as shown on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives) was out of this world.  The Gouda Grits were excellent (I'd never eaten grits before) and the oysters on the half shell were amazing (I'd never eaten those, either!).  Finally, the desserts...  The Bananas Foster Bread Pudding was just...  well...  I can't think of another superlative!  Oh, and the service?  Professional but very, very friendly.  The staff have great senses of humor!

I don't know why it took us so long to finally get here.  I typically flock to any joint on Triple D but I guess I just don't make it near the Strip too often.  Came with my wife and baby, and although dinning area is small, we sat comfortably.  Staff was especially friendly and the owner walked around greeting tables. These are the things that impress my wife.  As for me, it's the food that really matters!  Lola's does Creole right and then some.  From hush puppies to soft shell crab to jambalaya, you can't go wrong.  I will point out that I've never lived in LA so my opinion is that of a Nawlins tourist.  But I know what my taste buds like, and they tell me I need to go back to Lola's again sometime soon!
